name: Carefree at Windansea (405)
summary: Located in the heart of La Jolla, this well appointed two bedroom/two full bath condo is located just half a block to Windansea Beach and walking distance to many local restaurants.
space: This modern 3 level condo is completely furnished, beautifully decorated, and fully stocked. Enter from the garage or front door to the main entry hall. Go up the stairs to the first level to the bedrooms. There is a comfy king bed in the master, ceiling fan and a full ensuite bathroom with oversized tiled walk in shower. The second bedroom has a queen bed and ceiling fan, and the is a full bath in the hallway with fully tiled tub and shower.  Go up the stairs to the top level to main living area, spacious dining room with comfortable seating for up to six guests, Living room has 38" flat screen and more comfortable seating . Gourmet kitchen is nicely equipped kitchen with everything you will need to prepare meals featuring island gas range and all appliances. Patio with BBQ grill is located off of the living room perfect for family cookouts There is a half bath and laundry room for your convenience also on this level. Bonus office room has has desk and chair to allow for a work space

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 3,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.
access: The condo is three levels: one car garage on first level, bedrooms on second level, and kitchen and living space on third level. There is no elevator.  2 Bedrooms (1 King, 1 Queen) 2½ Baths Air Conditioning Balcony Condominium High Speed Internet Maximum Occupancy: 5 WIFI Walk to Beach Washer & Dryer pets considered

name: Private Bedroom and Private Bath
summary: Private bedroom and bath. Full access to common areas,washer/dryer, cable,WiFi. Close to beach, Sea World, bars, I-5, public transit. Quiet area of Pacific Beach. Friendly cat that thinks he's a dog. Does not go into airbnb/guest rooms.
space: I recently took a break from hosting for a few months. I am now ready to host again. House furnished in eclectic, antique, vintage style. Private bedroom/bathroom,full access to common areas, washer/dryer. One mile from the beach and Crystal Pier. Close to shopping, bars, bay, I-5, and downtown. My house is not your typical beach house. I don't have pastels and ocean blues and greens. I have a very eclectic style. My home is furnished with antique and vintage style furniture. There is no smoking allowed in the home, under any circumstance; but you are welcome to smoke on the patio. As with many houses close to the beach, this condo does not have central air conditioning. However, there is always a cool cross breeze blowing and I have floor fans available for your use. The temperature is usually comfortable. Full access to all common areas (kitchen, living room, dining area, in home washer and dryer, patio).  Street parking is easy to find in front of the house. You are welcome to use t

neighborhood_overview: I recently took a one and a half month break from hosting. I am now ready to host again.
notes: My house is one mile from the beach. I do have cable T.V. and WiFi. I provide coffee, and you have full access to my kitchen. There is ample street parking available directly in front of my house. If you are planning to arrive late or at a time when parking my be scarce we can make arrangements for you to use my assigned space. Street parking should be used at other times. If you are coming to San Diego to enjoy the beach and the local attractions, my home will probably be a good fit for you. If you are coming to Pacific Beach to party, my home will not be a good fit.  I live in a residential part of Pacific Beach where people raise their families. I have elderly neighbors and other neighbors with small children. I expect my guests to show common courtesy.
transit: I am a two short blocks from the main street (Garnet), so there is easy access to buses, cabs, Uber, Lyft, etc. I am two miles from the Old Town Trolley stop which will give you access to all of downtown for just a few dollars.
access: Full access to all common areas (kitchen, living room, dining area, in home washer and dryer, patio).  Street parking is easy to find around the house. You are welcome to use the kitchen to cook your meals, the washer and dryer to do your laundry, and to spend time in the dining and living room areas.
interaction: When making a reservation request, please tell me a little about yourself.  Please remember that this is my private home that I am opening to you, and not a hotel service. I like to know a little about guests before I accept reservation requests. This is especially important if you have no prior reviews or references.   I will not approve requests that do not include a personal message and introduction. Thank you for your understanding.
house_rules: I expect guests to clean up after themselves in common areas, and to respect my home.   1. No smoking in the house. 2. Do not bring other people who were not approved at the time of booking back to the house (for the sake of courtesy and safety).  3. Please do not take food or beverages into the bedroom. I work hard to keep the bedroom and living spaces clean and appreciate your consideration of this. 4. Please do not disturb my neighbors. If you have questions or concerns please ask me. My neighbors are not your hosts, I am.  Please understand that with  the rise in popularity of Airbnb hosting in Pacific Beach there are numerous people coming in and out of the neighborhood. I want to respect my neighbor's privacy and want them to be disturbed as little as possible.
host_about:
I love living by the beach. I am happy to give you suggestions on places to go, things to do, etc.

If you choose to stay in my home I will respect your privacy and follow your lead on the level of interaction (or not) between us.

name: Tropical Hideaway (372)
summary: Come relax in this spacious, second level beach cottage and enjoy all that La Jolla has to offer.
space: Perfectly located, you can start your mornings off with a quick three minute walk down to La Jolla's most famous and beautiful beach, Windansea Beach or stroll up to one of the local restaurants and grab breakfast and a cup of coffee. Or, drive a mile up the road and spend the day enjoying all of the famous shopping and restaurants of the La Jolla Village. Perfect for a couple looking to get away or a small family, this unit can sleep three comfortably. The master bedroom boasts a super comfortable memory foam king-sized bed. In addition, the living room has a sleeper sofa which can be used to sleep on additional person. A fully equipped kitchen and a deck with outdoor grill also makes for perfect sunset barbecues! The private and tranquil yard is tropically landscaped with exotic palm trees, bamboo, and colorful Ti plants from around the world and has a brand new private 3 person Jacuzzi hot tub perfect for a relaxing ending to the day. name: Seashell Cottage (530)
summary: Newly furnished and tastefully decorated in sea inspired hues throughout, the Seashell Cottage is a peaceful and soothing private vacation home located in a quiet Windansea Beach neighborhood.
space: Enter this home through the welcoming enclosed front porch and step into the spacious living room with beautiful hardwood floors and comfortable furnishings decorated in a tranquil ocean inspired decor. There is ample seating, lots of windows to let in sunshine and ocean breezes and large flatscreen TV. French door leads out to the patio. The adjacent large dining room has a beautiful table with seating for 6 guests and a charming crystal chandelier and relaxing ocean art to compliment your family meals. The fully equipped kitchen is off the dining room and has everything you will need to prepare family meals including dishwasher and gas range. summary: Private Room NEW Carpet Connected Bath Extra Fridge Queen size bed New organic mattress, Ceiling fan, Closet, hangers Garden window with retractable black out shades! Shared common areas, Beautiful yard BBQ patio area grass Jacuzzi fruit trees Roses!

neighborhood_overview: Nice, quiet residential neighborhood walking distance to banks shops grocery stores Target Marshalls Starbucks restaurants etc.  Our House is located in a nice, quiet, centrally located Clairemont neighborhood with easy freeway access, less than 5 miles to the beach, 15 mins to la Jolla shores, 16 mins to la Jolla cove, 15 mins to sea world and 18 mins to the San Diego zoo 15 mins to downtown & 18 mins to Coronado.  We are about a couple of blocks away from the neighborhood park with playground, baseball fields and canyon trails!
notes: We love to show our guests around or make suggestions for good places to eat, visit, must see tourist spots etc! See all of our glowing reviews for details on what our previous guests liked about staying here!
transit: We are within walking distance of 3 different bus stops! One goes down balboa, a straight shot to Pacific Beach, or you can walk to either the west side of the neighborhood to catch the 41 straight to UCSD, or the east side to catch the 41 to fashion valley mall etc, just grab a bus routes app to coordinate where you want to go! Each stop is within a few blocks of our house, 5 min or less walk.
access: Guests have access to Washer and dryer in garage, common areas: 2 living rooms, main fridge, dishwasher, fenced yard with Jacuzzi hot tub, grass, bbq patio area, several fruit trees, berries and veggie garden. (Backyard is shared with our other airbnb guests)!
interaction: The guest interaction is up to you! We have had guests in our extra rooms who had dinner and a game night together with us, others have kept to themselves. We are around to hang out or u r free to retreat to the privacy of your room- totally up to you! We will be traveling for 6 weeks and renting our rooms out while we are gone. So the house will be shared with our other airbnb guests. All very nice, & highly reviewed.
house_rules: No Smoking Please Verify your ID through your profile on Airbnb before booking and provide iD upon check-in.  Must be 21 years of age or older or traveling with parent or legal guardian.  No parties or inviting any extra guests other than those rented to through Airbnb.  This is a family neighborhood, please no loud noise or other disturbance to the neighbors.  Pets must be approved of in writing and paid for as an additional guest per night.  Jacuzzi - Please close and lock lid and press minus button to lower temperature to 98 when not using.  Owner will maintain jacuzzi, please do not ad chemicals.  Please no food or drinks or guests under the age of 16 allowed in the jacuzzi.    NO Standing or sitting on Jacuzzi cover.  No jumping or diving.  Use at your own risk.   The Cleaning fee is charged to help cover the cost and time of cleaning the room and Laundering bedding and towels which are provided clean for each guest. Please empty your trash can and clean any messes you have made b
host_about:
Hi! 
I'm Rachel, I love the beach and playing sports.  I'm a great cook, love to read and watch movies.  I'm easy going, relaxed and friendly and I'm looking forward to having you stay here in one of our beautiful homes in America's Finest City!  We enjoy hosting long term and short term stays and have several different size homes located throughout the county. We are sure to have something available that suits your needs.  We are glad to have you stay and do our best to make you comfortable, and are on call for anything you need during your trip!

My husband says I should open a restaurant to showcase all of his favorites of my cooking. If you stay in our home You may get a chance to sample something while you're here from his list of favorites like Vietnamese Pho Noodle Soup, our Real Italian family recipe Lasanha (Brazilian Portuguese spelling! This Italian Family recipe was passed onto our Brazilian grandmother by her Italian Mother-In-Law) or my own Creme Brûlée recipe!  All home made from scratch :)

Favorite travel destination: Fernando de Noronha, Brasil

summary: Sea Lane Sand Dollar is a three level home located in the Beach Barber Tract just two short blocks from the famous Marine Street beach in La Jolla.
space: The spacious 2,330 square foot house has four bedrooms and two and a half baths and is in a prime location for guests to enjoy all that La Jolla has to offer. Ideal for large groups or multiple families with children, the layout of this home offers guests the options of both privacy as well as large areas of shared space. The downstairs level has three bedrooms , two with queen beds and one with two twin beds. Also located downstairs there is a bonus room with a twin bed and a sitting area perfect for watching TV, playing games, or relaxing.  The second level of the home has a spacious living and dining room perfect for family gatherings and meals. The living room boasts a 50” flat screen TV and the dining room comfortably seats eight guests. The kitchen is quite spacious, fully stocked, and has Viking stainless steel appliances. name: Bungalow by the Bay Sunsets & Sails
summary: The most spacious bungalow around. Guests can hang out in the front yard "beach" to watch all the bay's activities and beautiful skies and not have to drive at all. The back yard boasts a 6 person hot tub, sun deck, grill, grassy area and patio furniture.
space: You can spend a fabulous vacation in an adorable, newly remodeled Bungalow by the Bay, both inside and out, just steps away from Sail Bay in beautiful San Diego, CA. 3 bed, 1 bath home sleeps up to six people. Fenced in back yard with bbq and jacuzzi, garage, green space and a deck.  Perfect for families with kids or couples looking for a romantic get away.  Fully remodeled kitchen with modern "retro inspired" appliances including a fully functional O'Keefe and Merritt stove with oven.  The kitchen has everything you need for meals you've slow cooked all day or gourmet fair you've whipped up for a special occasion. Enjoy the fireplace, big screen tv,  or unobstructed views of Sail Bay for the most awesome sunsets around.  Literally just steps away from the boardwalk which takes you around the bay and to the ocean. There's a cool breeze that comes off the bay daily and flows through the windows creating the most relaxing and refreshing experience. I offer a library of books for  your en
description: The most spacious bungalow around. Guests can hang out in the front yard "beach" to watch all the bay's activities and beautiful skies and not have to drive at all. The back yard boasts a 6 person hot tub, sun deck, grill, grassy area and patio furniture. You can spend a fabulous vacation in an adorable, newly remodeled Bungalow by the Bay, both inside and out, just steps away from Sail Bay in beautiful San Diego, CA. 3 bed, 1 bath home sleeps up to six people. Fenced in back yard with bbq and jacuzzi, garage, green space and a deck.  Perfect for families with kids or couples looking for a romantic get away.  Fully remodeled kitchen with modern "retro inspired" appliances including a fully functional O'Keefe and Merritt stove with oven.  The kitchen has everything you need for meals you've slow cooked all day or gourmet fair you've whipped up for a special occasion. Enjoy the fireplace, big screen tv,  or unobstructed views of Sail Bay for the most awesome sunsets around.  Literally ju
neighborhood_overview: I love the location of my Bungalow by the Bay. Close to everything. Private parking for at least 3 cars. I can watch sailboats and sunsets whenever I want from my own front yard. I'm within minutes of the beach in one direction and minutes of Interstates 8, 5, 805 and 15 but enjoy the peace and quiet of a quaint neighborhood of Pacific Beach. It's the best of everything. When the day is done I get to come home to my big screen tv, BBQ and hot tub.
notes: I've been told my beds are some of the most comfortable. And my kitchen has just about everything you'll need.  Although there is no AC unit, the constant bay breezes provide a very nice cool breeze most of the year.  The average daily temperature YEAR ROUND here on the water is 72 degrees. Being chilly is probably more of a problem than being too warm.  So don't let that deter you from renting the Bungalow by the Bay.  It's comfy and cozy, in a good way!   It truly feels like home away from home.
transit: The bus stop is a block away.  And there's always Uber!!
access: Less than 50 steps away to beautiful clear and calm waters of Sail Bay in Mission Bay. Ride one of our beach cruisers around the bay to many of our local attractions. Beach. Restaurants. Coffee shop. Playgrounds. Picnic areas. Roller coaster. Sailing. Sea World. All within a short scenic bike ride.

neighborhood_overview: The very best that California has to offer is within driving distance from our home.  I am located in the beautiful suburbs of University City and are a stone’s throw from world famous La Jolla and Del Mar beaches. Take your shoes off to enjoy the soft white sandy beaches of La Jolla, while overlooking the sandy coves, rocky cliffs to watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. Visit the salt water aquarium and championship golf course of Torrey Pines overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Enjoy a romantic meal at some of our famous restaurants on the beaches. Enjoy the sunshine all year round with comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. All of these are just a couple of minutes away. Walking distance from the house you will find the Westfield Mall, restaurants and beautiful parks.   The neighborhood is very safe and quiet and the building itself is secured by a security officers maintaining everyone's safety.
notes: I prefer stays of three nights or more but will work with you if our calendar can accommodate shorter stays. Please send an email inquiry and we will be more than happy to let you know. Also note our home includes the following rental options: booking of either room or the entire house.
transit: There are many forms of transportation in San Diego. I recommend a rental car. I have established a wonderful relationship with a vendor locally and are happy to provide you the information (only if requested by the guest and encourage you to compare their rates).  There is the option of Lfyt or Uber- car services similar to a taxi cab but more personable, friendly, cost effective, and fun. If interested, contact Lfyt or Uber through your phone. Lyft cars have a pink mustache on the front. Uber uses comfort vehicles such as Lincoln Town Car or SUV's. Their cost is slightly higher than Lyft and worth looking into for evening fine dining transportation. Taxis are available and are the most expensive of the above listed modes of transportation. Finally there are the public bus routes that travel all throughout the city. Bus schedules are available online or just email me, I am happy to help you plan out your route for your convenience.
access: My home is conveniently located blocks from Westfield Mall, Shopping Plaza, and Interstates 5 & 805. There are excellent rental cars services that provide us a discount so if you are interested please ask. Public transportation is also available in many forms such as taxi, Lyft, Uber, and the bus.  If you have any questions about what these services are please ask since they are extremely cost effective and convenient. All guests have full access to the following: Washer and Dryer in the apartment unit, Dishwasher, Full Kitchen, Full Size Refrigerator, WiFi, Cable, Coffee Maker, Coffee Press, Juicer. Guests have access to the pool, jacuzzi, tennis courts and indoor racket ball.
interaction: I like to treat our guests as family. Your stay in San Diego should be pleasant, comfortable and hassle free. You are truly taken care of during the entire reservation process from the beginning to the end. I am available during the listing and during your stay. I do like to touch base after a couple of days to ensure that your stay is comfortable.  If your visit has a special occasion, let me know how we can help you make this trip more memorable for you (birthdays, anniversaries, reunions etc.). My goal is to be available for you!
house_rules: Once your reservation has been booked and accepted, I will email you a welcome letter with all the necessary information about the house.  Check in is after 4 PM and checkout is before 11 AM. I can be very flexible with check in and checkout times. For early check in or late checkout we will always try to make that possible, but if our apartment is booked by other guests it will depend on their schedules. In the event of delayed arrivals (the unexpected flights that have been cancelled and other similar acts of nature) I will work with you to make the remaining part of your stay pleasurable. -No pets allowed  -Smoking allowed only outdoors on the private patio or private balcony. Absolutely no smoking indoors.  You may smoke outside the property but we ask that you please pick up all cigarette butts. -No Parties (at least no loud enough to disturb our neighbors) -No Overnight guests beyond those on the reservation  -Intoxicated people are not allowed on the premises (Our home and our b
host_about:
Hello, my name is Rose and want to thank you for visiting my home page. I love to travel , bike, hiking, safari excursions, watch theater arts, go to concerts and really see the world. There is nothing that we would not try just to say we did it:) We are privileged to be able to share our home with others.  I want to provide you not only a warm welcome but also the comfort and assurance that we are here to be a resource to you as well. If you have a particular interest in doing something specific while in town, please let me know if I can assist. Thanks again and Ilook forward to hearing from you :-)

Please feel free to email me with any questions you may have about our home. We look forward to hearing from you!

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 2,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

name: Private master suite at heart of SD
summary: This place is situated in a cul-de-sac quiet away from any noises! It's modern & sun-soaking, with walking distance to high-end Westfield shopping mall and restaurants. Close to UCSD and beach. High speed WIFI, kitchen, and private bathroom provided.
space: Your room is upstairs on 2nd floor: it's modern, clean, quiet and very comfortable. This end-unit townhouse is upgraded, with open floor plan and spacious living area, and is close to everything: walking distance to Westfield mall, grocery stores, various restaurants/bars, and bus station; minutes of driving to La Jolla Cove/Shore, UCSD. High quality beds and cotton linens and towels, and soap / shampoo are provided. Very high speed Wifi throughout the house. Just minutes to: - UC San Diego - I-5, 805, 52 -- (for quick access to all of San Diego) - (walking distance) UTC Shopping Mall, Ralphs, Trader Joe's & Whole Foods - Hospitals -- Scripps Green, Scripps Memorial & UCSD Thornton - 4 miles to La Jolla beaches (La Jolla Cove, Shore, etc.) - 3.5 miles to Torrey Pines Golf Course - 15 minutes to Del Mar Racetrack

High quality beds and cotton linens and towels, and soap / shampoo are provided. Very high speed Wifi throughout the house. Just minutes to: - UC San Diego - I-5, 805, 52 -- (for quick access to all of San Diego) - (walking distance) UTC Shopping Mall, Ralphs, Trader Joe's & Whole Foods - Hospitals -- Scripps Green, Scripps Memorial & UCSD Thornton - 4 miles to La Jolla beaches (La Jolla Cove, Shore, etc.)
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to Westfield mall, grocery stores and hot restaurants like Eureka!, Draft Republic, Tender Greens, etc. Minutes of driving or UBER to UCSD, and world famous La Jolla Shore. It's also close to Torrey Pines Glider port, a great hang gliding & paragliding park. La Jolla Shores and San Diego in general has a great year around climate of 72 degrees with nice a breeze. Winter nights cool into the low 60's. There is never a bad time of year to vacation here. Water temperature in summer 70-73 degrees and 59-65 in winter. Use of a wetsuit makes it year round for surfing, kayaking and paddle boarding.  Torrey Pines Golf Course has great views of the ocean. Balboa Park is great for all types of Museums as well as La Jolla Contemporary Art. For Families Sea World and San Diego Zoo and LEGOLAND are a must. Disneyland is 1.5 hour drive from San Diego.  The area around has a beach village appeal with authentic owner-operated restaurants, featuring Parisian style outdoor dining.
transit: All modes of transportation available including taxi service, car rentals, and public transportation. We are also conveniently located to the bus stop (e.g., 41, 921). The bus is inexpensive (2.5) for one ride and will take you to and from UCSD, downtown San Diego, etc.  You can also walk to many nice restaurants and shopping mall. Starbucks, Einstein Bagels, European Deli, Regents Pizzeria, Mexican, Nozomi Sushi restaurant and others can be reached by foot from the house.
access: Besides the private master suite with private bathroom, our kitchen is open for light use. There is a washer and dryer in the garage. Community pool is accessible. Guest can use any open parking space in the community (there is usually plenty). For other needs, just let us know.
interaction: Generally we setup the checkin process so guests won't have to meet up with us. If we're at home, we always enjoy talking to our guests. We are very accessible by phone and by email as well.
house_rules: Our neighborhood is full of amazing people just like yourself. We want to make sure everyone is comfortable therefore we kindly request that you keep noise levels to considerate levels (quiet hours 12 - 7am) Please be minded that our home is strictly nonsmoking. If you must smoke, we kindly request you to do it outside the house.  Please treat the house as if it was your own and keep it clean. To protect the flooring and reduce the amount of bacteria and allergens in the house, please take your shoes off. It also helps to keep a good feng-shui in the house.  Thank you for your kind cooperation.
host_about: My name is Kexi, and I'm a passionate software engineer. I spend lots of time in front of my laptop, coding and sipping tea. In my spare time, I usually read books, go shopping, or do some creative painting.

name: Seascape Haven (320)
summary: This incredibly charming beach home is located in the heart of La Jolla, California’s beautiful coastal community.
space: Hardwood floors, soaring ceilings, beautiful wood moldings, and classic coastal design flow through this home, and the amazing outdoor living spaces provide you a multitude of choices. The flagstone patio with fireplace, private ocean view jetted hot tub, and roof top deck with spectacular panoramic ocean views are sure to leave you relaxed and refreshed! The home is nestled amongst a cluster of palm trees with lush landscaping and flowering plants behind a beautiful garden gate. summary: Our detached home is adjacent to the park and centrally located in Golden Hill / South Park with shops and restaurants in walking distance.  This house is family & pet friendly with it's own enclosed yard.
space: Relax.  This home has been beautifully decorated with simple, clean furnishings and is ready to offer you a wonderful stay while visiting San Diego. Our home has 3 bedrooms, which fits 6 comfortably.  It has everything you will need with a nice outdoor area and park next door. Free street parking is available.
description: Our detached home is adjacent to the park and centrally located in Golden Hill / South Park with shops and restaurants in walking distance. This home has been beautifully decorated with simple, clean furnishings and is ready to offer you a wonderful stay while visiting San Diego. Our home has 3 bedrooms, which fits 6 comfortably.  It has everything you will need with a nice outdoor area and park next door. Free street parking is available. Guests will need to have a smart phone with the August Smart Lock app installed.  This will allow you to unlock the door using the bluetooth on your phone. The kitchen is fully equipped (microwave, toaster, fridge with ice maker) and stocked with basics for cooking.  The TV connects to local channels, Netflix, and other streaming services.  The private yard has patio furniture and plenty of space for children and/or pets to enjoy outside.  Free onsite laundry is available.  The
neighborhood_overview: Location, Location, Location! This home is centrally located adjacent to the historic San Diego neighborhoods of Golden Hill and South Park. A short walk North-East will take you to the wonderful shops in South Park (search South Park SD) Heading West towards 25th street will feature delicious pizza at Luigi's, coffee at Krakatoa, and others stores. The world famous San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park is only 5 minutes away.  The park adjacent to the house is popular for picnics, sunbathing, pickup sports, and features some great climbing trees.  Traveling with children or dogs?  There are two playgrounds in walking distance and a full-sized dog park at Grape Street within 10 minute walk. If you're interested in trail jogging/walking, there are great options nearby (search "Balboa Park Hiking and Biking Trails").  We're closest to Golden Hill. Travel Distance / Times to Nearby Destinations: - Balboa Park (Zoo) = 2 miles / 5 min - Downtown / Gaslamp = 2 miles / 5 min - Convention Center = 3 m
notes: We are in the flight path of San Diego Airport. They are restricted from flying between 11pm and 6am. The planes do cause the occasional conversation interruption during peak hours while you are outside, but noise is minimal inside the home with the windows closed.   Our house also has ceiling fans in every room, which are great at keeping the house at a comfortable temperature.
transit: If you're not driving your own car there are several options to get around.  Lyft-Uber-Taxi rides are inexpensive because of the central location.   The #2 bus to downtown and North Park is just one block away.   If you're feeling more adventurous there is a DecoBike stand 1 block away (search DecoBike San Diego).
access: Guests will need to have a smart phone with the August Smart Lock app installed.  This will allow you to unlock the door using the bluetooth on your phone. The kitchen is fully equipped (microwave, toaster, fridge with ice maker) and stocked with basics for cooking.  The TV connects to local channels, Netflix, and other streaming services.  The private yard has patio furniture and plenty of space for children and/or pets to enjoy outside.  Free onsite laundry is available.  There's also a Pack-N-Play available for guests with little children. There are 4 beds in the 3 rooms. A queen, a double, and a trundle bed with two twin mattresses.  Photos are available in the listing.
interaction: You will have exclusive access to the home during your stay.  We are usually in Los Angeles, so unlikely to meet during your stay.   Your neighbors in the rear house are also Airbnb guests.  Feel free to say hello :-). If you are unable to locate the residence, please contact us by phone immediately.

Please treat the property as if it were your own. 4) Sorry, cats are not included in the pets allowed (common allergen). 5) Guests should utilize the beds for sleeping.  No sleeping on the couch. 6) Do not flush wipes, paper towels, feminine products, of any other type of trash down the toilet.  This can cause major sewage blockages at the house. 7) The Host is not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. The Host is not responsible for the loss or damage of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises or others whom they invite to use the premise. name: Private Studio Near The Beach
summary: Detached studio with private entrance near the beach in Ocean Beach.  Queen memory foam bed with premium linens, futon, kitchen, full bath, cable, wifi, patio.  Walk to beach, restaurants, bars, shopping.  Enjoy one of San Diego's best neighborhoods.
space: The studio is located in Ocean Beach, seven blocks up the hill from the beach. Ocean Beach is a great place to surf, go tide pooling and explore the eclectic mix of nearby restaurants, bars and shops. Enjoy the temperate San Diego climate and laid back lifestyle. Location is close to Sunset Cliffs Natural Park,  Sea World, Mission Bay, downtown San Diego, the airport, Fisherman's Landing, and other beach communities.  It is about 8 miles from the convention center with public transit easily accessible to get you there and elsewhere around town.  Freeways are also close. Both the bed and futon are queen size, and the bed has a comfortable memory foam mattress. High quality linens and towels are included.  There is a kitchen with a full fridge and all basic cooking utensils. It also has a coffee maker, toaster, microwave, gas range and oven as well as a distant view of the ocean. The bathroom includes a shower and tub, hair drier, shampoo, soap, and towels.

neighborhood_overview: Ocean Beach which is a fun town with lots of restaurants and bars situated next to the beach.  There is great surfing, sunbathing, and swimming all close by.  The scenic Sunset Cliffs Natural Park just south of Ocean beach is a fun place to go for a hike or find your own private picnic spot.  It is a quiet neighborhood, but very close to several of the top attractions in San Diego.
notes: A Pack and Play is available by request.
transit: The town of Ocean Beach is just down the hill and the coast is 7 blocks away.  You can walk to the beach in about 15 minutes.  There are several bus stops close by which can take you to the trolley or directly downtown for easy access to the convention center or other points around the city and county.  Car2go cars area also normally parked in the neighborhood.
access: The space is a detached back house with private entrance and use of the patio and fully enclosed back yard.  It is accessible through the alley and there is dedicated off street parking for two cars.  There is a combination door lock and guests will be given the code to come and go as needed.  Check in time is 3:00 PM and Check out is 11:00 AM.  After hours check in is also available.
interaction: A large concrete wall separates the owners who live next door.  We are ready to help with anything you need.
house_rules: No noise after 9:00 pm.  No smoking inside the unit and no parties please
host_about: I have lived in San Diego for 12 years and work in the IT field.  My wife is a teacher and we have a two year old daughter.  We enjoy an active lifestyle and exploring all that San Diego and Baja have to offer.  We are eager to help you find the best of this amazing town has to offer and make new friends along the way! Just let us know if you need anything or we are happy to let you have a relaxing time on your own.

neighborhood_overview: San Diego is known for its year-round sunny skies, pleasant temperatures, and beautiful beaches. And right in the middle of it all, WorldMark San Diego - Balboa Park is ready to host you in one of the greatest cities in California. Your downtown, art deco–style resort consists of 68 units that are either studios or one-bedrooms units. The five-story completely renovated property was built in 1928. While you're here, walk over to the historical and always lively Gaslamp Quarter (.5 miles away) for dinner in one of Fifth Avenue’s hot spots, such as Rei Do Gado, Croce’s, or, if you really want to splurge, The Fish Market. You may want to block off some time for Balboa Park—only .25 miles from the resort. The park is akin to San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park or New York City’s Central Park and is, in fact, the nation’s largest urban cultural park, coming in at 1,174 acres. host_about:
I moved here from Italy 6 years from Napoli, Italy to enjoy the California life style.

I hope to have the pleasure to meet you in my house. Ciao!

space: **New!! Have a Star Wars Staycation! Watch Star Wars Episodes I-VI free from our Amazon video collection in the comfort of our guest cottage. One room has a queen size bed and the other has a queen size foldout couch. The bathroom includes a bath and shower. There are two private entrances; we ask that guests exclusively use the door that accesses the street and not the door that opens onto the backyard. Mini fridge, television, microwave and coffee maker also included. We do not have AC. The weather is beautifully temperate for most of the year but it can get hot especially in August and Septmber. neighborhood_overview: Our home is a true Craftsman built in 1924. As such, it is one of the oldest (and most charming in our opinion) in Pacific Beach. Many of our older neighbors have lived in this best kept secret of PB since childhood. We ask that all guests respect the quiet, family nature of our neighborhood. Please do not bring unregistered visitors to our home. Please be discreet as you come and go.
transit: You can easily walk, bike or drive to anywhere in PB. Mission Beach and La Jolla are also within easy reach on a bike or in a car. Freeway access is five minutes from our home. Bus stops are plentiful.
access: Guests have easy access to all that PB and San Diego has to offer including beaches, shops, theme parks and almost unlimited sunshine. We are happy to offer recommendations for our favorite places to eat, play and explore.
interaction: We are a busy family very much on the go. We love to meet new people but are just as happy to go about life and let our guests enjoy peace and privacy.
house_rules: No smoking. This includes inside the house as well as in the street or yard. No unregistered guests. We have children and will not allow unverified or uninvited visitors. We ask guests to be discreet and respectful when in the neighborhood. This includes minimizing noise late at night, refraining from disorderly (drunken) behavior and basically behaving as you would when you're a guest in someone's home.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 2,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

name: Cottage by the beach
summary: This rental is a one bedroom attached cottage unit 2 blocks from the beach! There is a small private outdoor space, a comfortable queen size bed and lots of things to do within walking distance.
space: This is a cozy, simple home.  A comfortable place to sleep (tempurpedic mattress topper and optional heated blanket!), and lots of light and character in the living room for enjoying the daytime hours.  The kitchen has a coffee maker, oven, fridge, etc.  There is no microwave or TV here, sorry.  But there is wifi and a record player.  While you're staying here I'm sure you'll want to go out to the beach and sunset cliffs, which are both easy to walk to.  There are also plenty of bars, great restaurants, and places to shop very nearby.  Dog beach and the pier are also close.  Ocean Beach is a fun, quirky neighborhood.   Please feel free to ask me anything you can think of so I can help you find out if this is the right place for you! There are planes that fly overhead that can be pretty loud during the day.  Neighbors are usually respectful, and I expect any guests staying here to be also.  No loud music/partying before 9am and after 9pm.

Please feel free to ask me anything you can think of so I can help you find out if this is the right place for you! There are planes that fly overhead that can be pretty loud dur
neighborhood_overview: This is an ideal location in a beautiful city.  OB is an edgy part of town with lots of dive bars and antique stores. The beach has great surfing.  The cliffs just 2 miles down the road are stunning.  The pier is one of the longest on the west coast, where you can whale and seal watch. There is a great noodle house, sushi joint, oceanfront dining, fish tacos, concert venues, yoga studios, record store, thrift stores, acai bowls, vegan food, indian food, etc.
notes: San Diego usually has moderate temperatures, but can get a little chilly in the winter.  There is a small space heater available for use if needed.   This is an older beach home with its quirks, please don't expect a hotel.  Everything will be clean and your basic amenities mentioned are here, but if there are other specific things you might need, please ask about it ahead of time.
transit: 10-15 minute drive to the airport and train station.  There are buses that come through Ocean Beach but I would highly recommend having a car in San Diego.   However, parking can be unpredictable.  I usually have no problem finding street parking near the house, however it can be tricky later at night.  And paying attention to street sweeping signs is necessary.
access: Kitchen, living room, outdoor space, bathroom with shower. (No closet, but a rack for hanging clothes.
interaction: This will be your own private place.  I'll be available by phone whenever you need.
house_rules: Dogs are okay if they are quiet and well trained.

neighborhood_overview: We are located 3 blocks from the bay, 5 blocks from the ocean, a 15 minute bike ride to Mission Beach roller coaster (you can use my bike, the key is in the apartment for you). We are also 4 blocks from all the main bars on Garnet Avenue & Mission Blvd. This is a party town, but the residents in the apartment complex are older and do not party at home so please be respectful. When you walk out the house you can see the bay from the steps. Everyone walks and rides bikes to get around, and everyone is very social. You can take the a boogie board to the beach, lay out, get some sun, and have a beer (or wine!) while watching the sunset. Everything you need can be found inside PB, but if you need to leave and come back the off street parking spot really comes in handy! We have AC and a heater to make sure the temperature fits your needs. Questions or looking for recommendations? Ask me! I am a San Diego local. :)
notes: Also available in the apartment: stove, oven, microwave, ninja blender, griddle, steamer, coffee maker, refrigerator, wine glasses, 1 boogie board, books (please do not take the books out of the apartment), Monopoly, Scrabble, chess, checkers, board games, ps4, modern war fare is preloaded on the ps4, game cube, super smash brothers, other games, iron, blow dryer, portable fan, portable heater, portable AC, vanity mirror, desk, wifi, cable tv, netflix, fold out couch, blow up air mattress, extra pillows, off street parking spot, laundry on site (quarters required) etc. Pretty much everything you will need, and much better than a hotel could ever do!
transit: Public transportation is 2 blocks away on Grand Avenue if you want to take the bus. Riding bikes is very popular and you can borrow my bike and lock if you promise to lock it up whenever you leave it out of sight. This is the best way to get around. Uber is also very reasonable and will cost you no more than 5 to get home from the beach and/or the bars if you don't want to walk late at night, and never drink and drive.
access: You will have access to the entire house.
house_rules: Quiet time after 10pm. Always lock the house when you leave. If you borrow the bike always lock it up, never leave it out of your sight! Bikes get stolen all the time. Please leave the books inside the apartment.

name: Comfy Room in an Artsy Urban Homestead
summary: Welcome to our artsy urban homestead! We live centrally located, just a few minutes drive to downtown, South Park, North Park, and Hillcrest. Also, we are close to both the trolley and bus lines.  We have our own tropical oasis and urban farm in our backyard, complete with jacuzzi, tiki bar, fire pit area, BBQ, pond with turtles/fish, and hens.  We are lovers of pets, and have 3 small dogs and a kitten. Please make yourself at home in both the shared spaces of the house and backyard.
space: We live centrally located to all the urban happening spots (Downtown, South Park, North Park, Hillcrest and University Heights) in San Diego, close to freeways (15, 94, and 805), bus lines (4,3) and the trolley. There is ample street parking available. We live in an urban residential mixed demographic area called Mt. Hope. We are 5 minutes from downtown, 15 minutes from the beach, and 10 minutes from the zoo.  The property includes all the amenities you would need for a vacation away from home. It's our little urban haven filled with a garden, chickens, pets (3 small sweet dogs and 1 loving kitten), jacuzzi, tiki bar, pond with turtles and fish, fire pit, BBQ, eclectic art, music, and love!! Guests have access to use of kitchen, living room, projector movie theater, use of hot tub, Wifi, BBQ, and washer & dryer. We request informed notice of your arrival and departure times, whether you will have visiting guests, and if you would like us to consider your pet.  Consideration: Please be considerate that we are sharing our home, so we please ask you to tidy up after yourselves in shared areas, and use energy saving practices. We ask that you be respectful whenever returning late at night and observe the 10pm noise curfew when outside.
host_about: Hello, we are a fun loving, artsy, and out going couple who love exploring new cities, going on adventures, and meeting awesome people along our journeys!! Alicia works as an Occupational therapist in the schools helping students with special needs to be independent problem solvers. Daria is a photographer who enjoys creating concept photos and professionally building up small businesses. We typically choose to stay with other AirBnB hosts when traveling, so we are especially conscious of the needs of travelers.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

name: Ocean View La Jolla Condo (503)
summary: Watch the surf roll from your living room, enjoy spectacular ocean, sunset, and white water views, steps from the beach, minutes from famous art museums, galleries, restaurants and shopping.
space: These are just a few of the many reasons to spend your vacation at this perfectly located La Jolla beachfront condo. This two bedroom, two bath comfortably furnished unit is filled with great books and offers fun and relaxation. Spend a quiet afternoon in the living room enjoying the sweeping ocean views, cool Pacific breezes, and world famous La Jolla sunsets. Or walk down to the beach and explore the tide pools and sandy beaches just 100 feet from your front door. In addition, the world famous Seal beach is just a block away. End the day by enjoying the view from the living room or let the sounds of the surf lull you to sleep. The master bedroom boasts a King bed, ocean views and breezes, and a private bathroom while the second bedroom has a Queen bed and a shared bath. An air mattress can be provided for a small additional fee to provide extra sleeping space for one adult or two children. Additional amenities include wireless internet, cable, garage parking for one car with interior

space: Guests are sure to enjoy the numerous interior comforts as well as afternoons spent in the private and fenced in backyard which features comfortable patio furniture and a BBQ perfect for enjoying a cookout or cocktail hour with friends. neighborhood_overview: A favorite spot amongst college students and young adults living the California Dream, Pacific Beach is the iconic Southern California beach town. With three miles of boardwalk and a lively atmosphere, P.B. (as the locals call it) is a great place to find fun in the sun, and pleasures after dark. From funky beach bars and taco stands that welcome sandy toes, to sleek modern hotels, sultry night clubs and fine dining establishments, Pacific Beach offers a variety of things to do beyond the miles of sandy beaches.

neighborhood_overview: Sitting in the backyard enjoying the birds in the day or the city lights view in the evening, or just walking around the neighborhood, is a relaxing experience. However, when you venture out... You're minutes to grocery stores including Vons, Trader Joe's, Sprouts, and Whole Foods. There is also a Starbucks just minutes away as well as a laundromat, dry cleaner, pharmacy, sushi bar, Italian restaurant, etc. We have a beautiful shopping mall (UTC Mall) just 5 minutes up the road which has a luxury movie theater, Nordstrom, Macys, Tiffanys, and other great stores. 15 minutes the other direction and you have another mall with shops including another Nordstrom, Bloomingdales, and Niemann Marcus. We are close to many local attractions: - Beaches: Pacific Beach, Mission Beach, La Jolla Shores, Torrey Pines, etc. - San Diego Zoo - San Diego Wild Animal Park - Sea World - La Jolla Village - La Jolla Cove - Downtown San Diego - Little Italy - Swami's for surfing - Torrey Pines State Park - Torr
notes: For allergy considerations, although there is one dog that lives on the premises, he is a breed considered non-allergenic. He will not be there during your stay if you rent the whole house.
transit: You'll have quick access to freeways heading east/west (SR52) and north/south (I-1 and I-805). At our place you are close to everything!
access: If you rent the room, you'll be sharing the space with us during your stay. You'll have access and use of everything except the garage. That includes the full kitchen, bathroom (we have our own), front and back yard, BBQ grill and any fruit on the fruit trees and herbs in the garden.  :)
interaction: We are happy to spend time chatting with guests to get them acquainted with the house and our great city. We can recommend things to do and places to eat. We enjoy the outdoors so we can give advice on recreational activities too! We always make ourselves available during your stay for questions.
house_rules: This is our primary residence and we hope you treat it like your own. No pets, no smoking, no parties, no additional visitors.
host_about:
We are a married couple (20 years) who has been together since college. Love animals and travel.  We are quiet, clean and respectful. I am an interior designer and Scott is a geologist. Our home is in San Diego.

We first used Airbnb for a trip up and down the California Coast (strongly recommended!). We had a wonderful experience. Since then we have opened our home to host. We have had great experiences with people from the US, Germany, UK, Austria, Spain, Cyprus, and China.

We also used Airbnb on a motorcycle tour of Northern Europe in 2013 and Greece/Turkey last summer. We've used Airbnb stayed in the Netherlands, Latvia, Estonia, Czech Republic, Greece, Turkey, Italy, and Germany. It was super helpful to be able to find accommodations in small towns where there we no good hotel options and in big cities where hotels were quite expensive. Everyone helped us find accommodations for our motorcycle too.

name: Amazing Cottage, Steps to the Beach
summary: Bay Haven is a 2 bedroom / 1 bath renovated 1926 beach cottage with large outdoor patio & porch, located 2 houses from the bay (great view of the nightly Sea World fireworks) & a 3 min walk from the sea. Priced at 129-375/night depending on season.
space: This renovated beach cottage is located 2 houses from the bay beach (which has a great view of the nightly Sea World fireworks) & a 3 minute walk from the sea beach.  It accommodates up to 6 guests (but 4 is best) and comes with a parking spot and large outdoor patio/dining area.  Enjoy a cup of coffee on your exclusive use front porch as you watch the sunrise, then head inside to enjoy a family breakfast at your own pace in the fully equipped kitchen, or walk to one of the local restaurants featuring dishes like "Lemon French Toast" and "Pulled Pork 'n Eggs". Your dining table seats up to eight guests, and there is also an eat-in table in the kitchen for smaller meals. After breakfast, its time to figure out how to spend your day. The hallway closets and walk-in outside storage room hold everything you need to enjoy a day at one of the two beaches within walking distance – towels, chairs, umbrellas, coolers, beach toys, and even body boards (enough beach supplies for up to 7 guests.)

notes: We're very sorry but at this time we are only considering reservations from guests who have already been positively reviewed by another host. We don't live at the property and have had trouble with unreviewed guests behaving badly despite promising to be respectful of the property and our neighbors.  The main room of the cottage is air conditioned with a room air conditioner.  The air conditioner is usually in place July through October, but we will of course put it in temporarily in case of an unexpected heat wave! (The average high temperature in the hottest season is 76 degrees, so the AC doesn't get much use!!)
transit: There is a bus stop less than 1 block from the house, however San Diego buses are on the expensive side and do not run that often so we recommend a car or bike to get around locally.
access: You have access to the whole house! The front porch area and front patio is exclusive use to your cottage but guests in the other units may need to walk across is to access the laundry center or their unit. While it feels very private, please keep in mind that the rear wall of your cottage is shared by a little studio unit that may or may not be occupied.  Also our neighbors are very close on all sides (as is the case with most of Mission Beach) and many like to hang out quietly on their front patios -- so the situation is best for people who are okay with that sort of beach neighborhood culture as opposed to someone looking for a 'retreat' style environment!
interaction: We live in the neighborhood and are always around to deal with any issues or recommend activities or places to eat - but for the most part we prefer to leave our guests alone so they can  feel like they are at their own vacation home!
house_rules: NO PETS. This is a quiet, primarily residential street - no parties, gatherings, or events allowed! Violating this rule will result in the cancellation of the remainder of your stay, and you will be removed from the property. A good rule of thumb is to keep the maximum occupancy (day or night) pretty close to what's on the reservation. Having a couple friends over for dinner = not a problem.  Having your 30-person extended family over for a barbecue = not what we are interested in renting this home out for. We ask that you please read the full listing text to make sure the place will work for you. We are not able to offer refunds after check-in for guests who simply missed something in the listing.
host_about:
We are a husband and wife team who have been put in charge of renting out our family's lovingly furnished, fully equipped beach houses when they're not in use! We love meeting new people and helping visitor's figure out how to make the most of their time in this great city. We are pretty laid back and accommodating as hosts. We're relatively new to AirBNB, but not new to the business of running vacation rentals. 

We spend most of our time being foodies and enjoying the California lifestyle (sunshine, hot-tubbing, taking our pups to dog beach, and sipping locally brewed beers and Temecula wines.)  When we're not in San Diego, you can usually find us somewhere else pleasant and sunny - Puerto Rico, Italy, Greece, Bermuda, and Hawaii are some of our favorite haunts.

neighborhood_overview: The townhouse is located in the heart of San Diego. It's in the center and close to everything San Diego has to offer. Located less than a mile from Fashion Valley mall you are just a 10 minute walk to premium shopping, dinning, and entertainment. --5 min drive to Hillcrest (the trendy neighborhood catering to families, hipsters, beer connoisseurs and the San Diego LGBT community.) --6 min drive to Qualcomm Stadium (home of the San Diego Chargers). --7 min drive to Sea World and Fiesta Island (world famous amusement park and the birthplace of the modern day triathlon) --8 min drive to old town SD (SD history and Mexican restaurants everywhere) -9 min drive to Balboa Park (San Diego Zoo, big park) --10 min drive to downtown (Convention center, restaurants, bars, night clubs, Gaslamp District) --10 min drive to Ocean Beach --12 min drive to the airport --15 min drive to Coronado island
transit: Bus 25 and 120 are right on the corner and they can take you to the Fashion Valley transit center, however we always just walk because it is just a 10 minute walk. At the Fashion Valley transit center you can take the SDMTS trolley. The trolley costs 2.50 for one-way pass and you can take the trolley almost everywhere. (Old town, Sea Port Village, Convention Center, Downtown/Gaslamp, Qualcomm Stadium, etc.)

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

neighborhood_overview: This home is located in Bay Park, a desirable San Diego neighborhood overlooking Mission Bay and the ocean. The neighborhood is residential and a number of close families have small children, so we ask consideration for the neighbors. The location is central to San Diego and makes it very easy to get anywhere quickly.
notes: San Diego offers extensive outdoor activities, including beaching it, hiking, biking, surfing, swimming, boating, paddle boarding, sport fishing, jet skiing, and jogging. In the winter months snow skiing is available 2-3 hours away. You can surf and ski in the same day! Disneyland is 85 miles away, Sea World 5 minutes, Legoland 30 minutes, the beach 15 minutes, Mission Bay is .8 miles. San Diego temperatures only vary about 10 degrees on the average tempurature between winter and summer. Evenings almost always cool down as the sun sets regardless of the season, so you'll need light jackets/sweaters in the evenings.  May and June tend to have overcast/gray skies in the mornings here, usually burning off about 11am.
transit: Not much public transportation is close to the home except bus. But, within 10 minutes drive, trolley stations are available with access to a variety of locations in town. You will likely need a car, however.
access: The entire home is open to you with the exception of a detached room to the rear of the lot in which the owners store personal items.
interaction: We have lived in San Diego all our lives, and can direct you to a variety of beaches for sight-seeing, bathing, surfing, fishing and boating.  In less than 1 mile you are at Mission Bay (recreational bay) with a boat ramp, jet ski rentals, jogging and bike path (extensive) and various parks along the water.  The San Diego Zoo is only about 15 minutes away, downtown San Diego too, as well as Sea World, historic missions, sport fishing, golf, and plenty of shopping. We are happy to direct you to the sights or activities you prefer. We know all about many aspects of San Diego.
house_rules: The neighborhood is a residential family neighborhood, with children living all around, hence a quiet neighborhood in hours from 9pm until 8am. Children are welcome. No smoking, and no pets. The rules state no parties, but family gatherings are ok. Check out time is 11am, and late checkouts are unavailable due to prompt arrival of the cleaning crew. Late check outs will be charged 50/hr.
host_about: I am a retired software engineer who enjoys playing music, surfing, and traveling.  I love the music in Austin, Texas and the BBQ too. I enjoy trout fishing in streams (fly or spinners), and have been in California, Minnesota, and Colorado fishing. I know the town of San Diego very well, and can direct guests to the "locals" spots for surf, food, sight-seeing, fishing, golfing, sailing, paddle boarding, and much more. San Diego is an outdoors city.

host_about:
I have been an avid traveler for years. I stumbled upon airbnb in 2014 and fell in love with that idea of staying in the comfort in someones home instead of staying in a expensive Hotel. I loved it so much, I decided to try it in my own homes. Needless to say, I fell in love with hosting and entertaining people from all over the world! I look forward to hopefully doing the same for you during your travels! :) 

I have been a SUPER HOST on Airbnb since the program rolled out in early 2015.  Hosting 700+ guests over the 2015 year. You might be wondering what a Super Host is? A Super Host has to meet a strict criteria set in place by Airbnb. Airbnb does a assessment 4x a year (each quarter) to see if we have met the criteria for that quarter.  

My Host Mission:

1. Deliver 5 Star service 100% of the time to guests!
2. Offer a clean, safe and well organized home.
3. Offer value based pricing saving you  while giving you more!

I look forward to meeting you soon!  

Cheers, 
Greg

Vacations aren't fully relaxing and this can be your place that's only full of warmth and happiness. You are right next to a bathroom. Two nests control the temperature upstairs and down. The water softener will give you that smooth shave and clean feeling from the shower. Drink pure reverse osmosis water from a special tap off the kitchen sink. Guests are welcome to the entire ground floor with the only restriction being no use of the cooking areas of the kitchen. You are welcome to use the Reverse Osmosis tap for ultra pure water and the microwave to warm anything. There is an extra fridge to store your items. Guests can have as much or little interaction as they want. We will welcome you upon arriva
neighborhood_overview: This is an established community with older residents which means it is quiet. However, it is also among one of the top school systems with a strong sense of community. The nearby shopping center is new but not overcrowded and very close. This is a well manicured neighborhood with most folks hiring gardeners, cleaners and other regular services to maintain appearances.
notes: Reverse Osmosis system gives you ultra clean water. House is in a very convenient area such that almost any type of convenience is less than 10 minutes in some direction.
transit: Most people would have their own vehicle if they stay here. However, Lyft and Uber certainly service the area well.
access: Guests are welcome to the entire ground floor with the only restriction being no use of the cooking areas of the kitchen. You are welcome to use the Reverse Osmosis tap for ultra pure water and the microwave to warm anything. There is an extra fridge to store your items.
interaction: Guests can have as much or little interaction as they want. We will welcome you upon arrival then you may come and go as you please. We would love to spend time chatting and just as happy to give you your own space.
house_rules: Please remove your shoes and use the provided inside shoes as this keeps the floors pretty clean.  Please park along the street.  There is no smoking in or around the house.  We are up around 6 making noise and we expect reasonable quiet behavior after 9 p.m.  When showering please keep liner inside tub to avoid excess water on the floor. Cooking in the kitchen is not included but feel free to get water from the reverse osmosis tap and you may use the microwave. The T.V. has RGB, HDMI and Chromecast connections but we don't have cable.  Please leave the front door locked when coming and leaving.  We have two young polite girls so please be on your best behavior during your stay.

name: 3 Bedroom Pad by the Park
summary: Our detached home is directly adjacent to the park and centrally located in Golden Hill / South Park with shops and restaurants in walking distance.  This house is family & pet friendly with it's own enclosed yard featuring a kid clubhouse.
space: Relax.  This home has been beautifully decorated with simple, clean furnishings and is ready to offer you a wonderful stay while visiting San Diego.  Our family lived here for 6 years before relocating.  It has everything you will need with a great outdoor area and park next door.

It has everything you will need with a great outdoor area and park next door. Guests will need to have a smart phone with the August Smart Lock app installed. neighborhood_overview: Location, Location, Location! This home is centrally located adjacent to the historic San Diego neighborhoods of Golden Hill and South Park. A short walk North-East will take you to the wonderful shops in South Park (search South Park SD) Heading West towards 25th street will feature delicious pizza at Luigi's, coffee at Krakatoa, and others stores. The world famous San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park is only 5 minutes away.  The park directly adjacent to the house is popular for picnics, sunbathing, pickup sports, and features some great climbing trees.  Traveling with children or dogs?  There are two playgrounds in walking distance and a full-sized dog park at Grape Street within 10 minute walk. If you're interested in trail jogging/walking, there are great options nearby (search "Balboa Park Hiking and Biking Trails").  We're closest to Golden Hill. Travel Distance / Times to Nearby Destinations: - Balboa Park (Zoo) = 2 miles / 5 min - Downtown / Gaslamp = 2 miles / 5 min - Convention Cen
notes: We are in the flight path of San Diego Airport. They are restricted from flying between 11pm and 6am. The planes do cause the occasional conversation interruption during peak hours while you are outside, but noise is minimal inside the home with the windows closed. Our house also has ceiling fans in every room, which are great at keeping the house at a comfortable temperature.
transit: If you're not driving your own car there are several options to get around.  Lyft-Uber-Taxi rides are inexpensive because of the central location.   The #2 bus to downtown and North Park is just one block away.   If you're feeling more adventurous there is a DecoBike stand 1 block away (search DecoBike San Diego).
access: Guests will need to have a smart phone with the August Smart Lock app installed.  This will allow you to unlock the door using the bluetooth on your phone. The kitchen is fully equipped (microwave, toaster, Ninja blender, fridge with ice maker) and stocked with basics for cooking.  The TV connects to local channels, Netflix, and other streaming services.  The private yard has a covered porch, patio furniture, and grill.  Kids will enjoy playing in their own clubhouse.  Free onsite laundry is available.  There's also a Pack-N-Play available for guests with little children. There are 4 beds in the 3 rooms. Two full sized beds and a trundle bed with two twin mattresses.  Photos are available in the listing.
interaction: You will have exclusive access to the home during your stay.  We are usually in Los Angeles, so unlikely to meet during your stay.   Your neighbors in the front house are also Airbnb guests.  Feel free to say hello :-). If you are unable to locate the residence, please contact us by phone immediately.
house_rules: 1) Please respect our neighbors and keep noise to a minimum after 10pm.  No Parties. 2) There is parking for one vehicle in the driveway.  Additional cars should utilize street parking on 28th or A streets.  Please keep the alley parking available for residents. 3) Smoking is not allowed on the property. 4) We expect respectful behavior.  Please treat the property as if it were your own. 5) Sorry, cats are not included in the pets allowed (common allergen). 6) The clubhouse is only for kids, not pets.  Also, no pets in the beds. 7) Guests should utilize the beds for sleeping.  No sleeping on the couch. 8) Do not flush wipes, paper towels, feminine products, of any other type of trash down the toilet.  This can cause major sewage blockages at the house. 9) The Host is not responsible for any accidents, injuries or illness that occurs while on the premises or its facilities. host_about:
Hi! 
I'm Rachel, I love the beach and playing sports.  I'm a great cook, love to read and watch movies.  I'm easy going, relaxed and friendly and I'm looking forward to having you stay here in one of our beautiful homes in America's Finest City!  We enjoy hosting long term and short term stays and have several different size homes located throughout the county. We are sure to have something available that suits your needs.  We are glad to have you stay and do our best to make you comfortable, and are on call for anything you need during your trip!

My husband says I should open a restaurant to showcase all of his favorites of my cooking. If you stay in our home You may get a chance to sample something while you're here from his list of favorites like Vietnamese Pho Noodle Soup, our Real Italian family recipe Lasanha (Brazilian Portuguese spelling! This Italian Family recipe was passed onto our Brazilian grandmother by her Italian Mother-In-Law) or my own Creme Brûlée recipe!  All home made from scratch :)

Favorite travel destination: Fernando de Noronha, Brasil

name: Charming Casita with Bonus Room!
summary: Sunny studio condo with bonus room, full kitchen, WiFi, + beach equipment - a block and a half from the beach! "Tiny house" vibe. Everything you need for vacation, organized neatly in our cute little Casita. 85 - 219 per night depending on season.
space: This is a great, cozy, relaxing space two houses from the Bay beach and a 3 minute walk from the Pacific Ocean!  Beach goers have been coming to this little Casita since the 1930's and we're proud to carry on that tradition (with quite a few renovations & improvements!!)  It has a small 6' x 15' bonus room that serves as the living room (with loveseat, desk, and a TV), plus a separate galley kitchen with 4-burner stove, microwave, full fridge, and sink.  We have both an adult and a youth-sized air mattress to accommodate additional guests in the bonus room, but the entire place is open without any doors (aside from the bathroom door) so keep that in mind as you plan your stay. The main room features a bed & nightstand plus a 2-person bistro set and TV.  Calming colors throughout make the space seem even larger, and huge windows plus a skylight ensure tons of light.  This rental is located on a quiet, residential pedestrian walkway and is away from the front of the property (so has more

It has a small 6' x 15' bonus room that serves as the living room (with loveseat, desk, and a TV), plus a separate galley kitchen with 4-burner stove, microwave, full fridge, and sink.  We have both an adult and a youth-sized air mattress to accommodate additional guests in the bonus room, but the entire place is open without any doors (aside from the bathroom door) so keep that in mind as you plan your stay. The main room features a bed & nightstand plus a 2-person bistro
neighborhood_overview: Two beaches and a beachside amusement park with awesome restaurants within close walking distance - need I say more?!
notes: This property is air conditioned with a room air conditioner.  The air conditioner is usually in place mid July through mid October, but we will put it in temporarily in case of an unexpected heat wave! The average high temperature in the hottest season is 76 degrees, so the AC doesn't get much use.
transit: Public bus lines are less than 1 block away. Parking is on street only. At night/during high season it can be VERY difficult to find a spot.  So this is best for patient & flexible people (there is a public lot a few blocks away) or folks traveling without a car!
access: You will have access to the entire unit.  There is a small outdoor area with a bench, though the best option for outdoor space is to just pop over to the beach (there is also a grassy area before the beach) just two houses away.  Or walk a block and a half to the Pacific Ocean beach. This unit does not have an assigned parking space, but check out our Guidebook for the "secret" spots for on-street parking in the area.  Saturdays & Sundays during the day in the summer are bad, but in general street parking is relatively easy to find on weekdays, especially in the mornings and afternoons.
interaction: We are happy to have whatever level of interaction you'd like!  We can come in person to check you in, or we can leave the property on lockbox for you.
house_rules: NO PETS.  This rental is best for 2 adults or 2 adults + 1 or 2 young kids. If you are an adult couple traveling with other adults or with adult (college age or older) children, please check out our other rentals on the same property (1 BR cottage and 2 BR cottage), they would be a better fit! This is a quiet, primarily residential street - no parties, gatherings, or events allowed! Violating this rule will result in the cancellation of the remainder of your stay, and you will be removed from the property.
host_about:
We are a husband and wife team who have been put in charge of renting out our family's lovingly furnished, fully equipped beach houses when they're not in use! We love meeting new people and helping visitor's figure out how to make the most of their time in this great city. We are pretty laid back and accommodating as hosts. We're relatively new to AirBNB, but not new to the business of running vacation rentals. 

We spend most of our time being foodies and enjoying the California lifestyle (sunshine, hot-tubbing, taking our pups to dog beach, and sipping locally brewed beers and Temecula wines.)  When we're not in San Diego, you can usually find us somewhere else pleasant and sunny - Puerto Rico, Italy, Greece, Bermuda, and Hawaii are some of our favorite haunts.
