neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 2,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

name: Modern Ballpark Loft - Beautiful!
summary: This spacious, 1 bed / 1 bath modern loft with 12 foot ceilings and tons of natural light is in the center of the Ballpark District; a vibrant redevelopment area within the East Village neighborhood of Downtown San Diego, the best place to be!
space: The loft is beautifully decorated with original artworks and complimented by contemporary, mid-century modern furniture. 12 foot, south-facing floor-to-ceiling windows bring tons of natural light and add to the open, dramatic feel and a stunning handcrafted distressed steel room divider ties it all together.

name: 3BR House by Downtown, Zoo & Balboa
summary: Large, well located, 3BR, 2BA ideal for family or groups. This is a dedicated vacation rental property, so you won't have to deal with other people's "stuff".  Features hardwood floors, a fireplace, attic loft, sunny deck & laundry.  Optional studio unit with backyard and fire pit for 3 additional guests available.  Ample free parking.  Walk to park, playground, restaurants, bars, coffee, shops, yoga studios, tennis courts and community pool.
space: This centrally located classic Craftsman house features hardwood floors, a real fireplace, and old school charm with a fun, artistic vibe.  We've filled the house with art, books, and even vintage records you can play!   Please let us know how many couples, singles (including teenagers), children, and infants are in your group.  We can accommodate up to 2 infants up to 24 months old free. Top 10 Reasons This Should Be Your Next Vacation Rental! 1) This is a dedicated vacation rental, so you won't have to deal with anybody else's “stuff".  2) Costs a fraction of staying at the beach.  Use the Savings for your Airfare!  Discount priced for week-long and month-long stays. 3)  Ideal for large families and groups up to 8, or 11 when separate studio unit is available.  Kids will love the attic loft.   4) Quiet, convenient location by Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, and Downtown.  15 minutes from our beaches, airport, and anywhere that matters in metro San Diego. 5) Walking Distance to restaurant

neighborhood_overview: Fun and funky North Park started coming into its own early in the new millennium.  When a check-cashing store changed over to a dessert restaurant, local residents knew something was happening.  New restaurants are still opening, and the neighborhood has become home to hipsters from all walks of life.  But don't take my word for it.  Even the New York Times has written about all the good things going on in this neighborhood! + Bi-Weekly Free Summer Concerts at Nearby Bird Park. + The North Park Farmer's Market is every Thursday evening from 3 - 7pm on North Park Way at Herman Street. + Ray At Night artwalk just up the street is every month on the second Saturday night, from 6-10pm.  Art and free live music in a festive setting. + Critical Mass bicycle ride leaves from nearby Balboa Park at the water fountain off Park Blvd., 7pm on the last Friday of each month. + Annual Toyland parade every December Guided tours of homes and buildings in North Park by North Park Main Street organizatio
notes: * The homes in this area are relatively close together:  It is imperative guests respect quiet and privacy for our neighbors.  We enforce quiet hours between 10pm and 8am. * This rental is for overnight accommodations ONLY.  No house parties, special events, or media production permitted. * We welcome inquiries for stays up to 4 months.  For stays one month or longer, the security deposit is 1500.   For stays 3 months or longer, the security deposit is 2000.
transit: + We are perfectly located 3 blocks from North Park's active epicenter - close enough to walk to, but far enough for evening quiet and available street parking.  (See Guidebook) + Two stop signs and one traffic from downtown (5 minutes).  Downtown 5 minutes away by car, Airport 15 minutes away. + Minutes from San Diego's famous San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park. + Bus lines to downtown and crosstown 3 blocks away. + Taxi waiting station nearby.
access: I like to meet and orient my guests with a 10 minute overview of the house and neighborhood when possible.  Otherwise, we offer 24 hour access instruction for early or late arrivals.
interaction: I have have lived in San Diego for 25 years and love it here, so I really enjoy giving my guests recommendations on places to go and things to do see, according to their needs.  I live about 10 minutes away for convenience, and am always available by text or phone.
house_rules: * Check in after 4pm.  Check out by 11am.  Please use lock box & text me when checking out. * Rental is for overnight accommodations only.  This home shall not be used for house parties, special events, or media production. * Quiet hours are 10pm - 8am.  Patio closed at 10pm.  Please respect your neighbors in the back unit and surrounding properties. * Please keep excessive noise indoors by closing doors and windows when necessary. * Children on the premises shall be accompanied by an adult at all times. * No smoking indoors * Absolutely No pets * Please save energy by turning off lights and keeping doors /windows closed when temperature control is on. * Cookware and dishes shall be clean, dry, and placed back in cupboards or left clean in dishwasher. * Please put used sheets and towels in a pile on the floor; leave unused beds undisturbed to save water. * Trash shall be removed and put outside in the appropriate trash or recycling bins.  Trash bins shall be placed curbside weekly for
host_about:
Originally from New York, I'm a multi-media artist who loves to travel, take pix, meet people, and continue learning about the world.  Hosting my second home to visitors has totally added to that.  I love living in San Diego and really like sharing my city with others by hosting them and making suggestions around here according to their needs.

As a traveler, I like to take leisurely ride bikes to explore, visit contemporary art museums, take in the architecture, sample interesting sounds, explore with my camera, and of course meet the local people.

I also offer photography lessons for groups or privately to help people understand their digital cameras better, compose pictures better, and have more fun taking them.  Perfect for travelers visiting San Diego!

neighborhood_overview: San Diego is known for its year-round sunny skies, pleasant temperatures, and beautiful beaches. And now, right in the middle of it all, WorldMark San Diego - Mission Valley is ready to host you in one of the greatest cities in California.  You may want to block off some time for Balboa Park—only 4.5 miles from the resort. The park is akin to San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park or New York City’s Central Park and is, in fact, the nation’s largest urban cultural park, coming in at 1,174 acres. With eight gardens, 15 museums, nine restaurants and cafes, a golf course, the San Diego Zoo, a puppet theater, golf course, and the world’s largest outdoor organ (and this isn’t even a close to a complete list), you could do something different in Balboa Park every day for the next two months. Water lovers will also find endless possibilities. Cruise the bay on a boat excursion. Hang ten at Pacific Beach. Watch for whales at the Cabrillo National Monument. Scuba dive or snorkel off La Jolla Cove, wh

summary: Originally owned and operated as the La Jolla destination for the exclusive Lusso Club of the ultra wealthy, this contemporary 4,800 square foot WindanSea beach home designed by architect Lou Domini.
space: This home boasts of the highest quality construction and amenities to be found. Vaulted ceilings, four living floors, game room, top floor ocean view deck with brand new jacuzzi hot tub, and two kitchens with all of the appliances and technology expected for luxury living are only a few of the features for guests to enjoy. This professionally decorated vacation home boasts five bedrooms, four and a half bathrooms, and two kitchens throughout the expansive yet comfortable home. Built in 2006 using all steel and concrete construction, this ultra modern home is perfect for two families traveling together, large groups, and private functions. The bedrooms are evenly spread out throughout the house to provide maximum convenience and privacy for our guests. neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 3,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

And right in the middle of it all, WorldMark San Diego - Balboa Park is ready to host you in one of the greatest cities in California. Your downtown, art deco–style resort consists of 68 units that are either studios or one-bedrooms units. The five-story completely renovated property was built in 1928. While you're here, walk over to the historical and always lively Gaslamp Quarter (.5 miles away) for dinner in one of Fifth Avenue’s hot spots, such as Rei Do Gado, Croce’s, or, if you really want to splurge, The Fish Market.  You may want to block off some time for Balboa Park—only .25 miles from the resort. The park is akin to San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park or New York City’s Central Park and is, in fact, the nation’s largest urban cultural park, coming in at 1,174 acres. name: Downtown Victorian Gem - #1
summary: Located in Historic District on Slope above Downtown San Diego, beautiful Queen Ann Victorian Private Unit accommodates 4 people. Minutes from Convention Center, Gas Lamp district, Coronado & Airport. Easy Freeway, Trolley and Bus Line Access. Beautifully Decorated Featuring, Barbecue, Gazebo, Fire Pit & Laundry facility with Historic Cistern Basement.
space: This Multi-Unit Queen Ann Victorian was built in the early 1800's and was known in those days as “The Kennedy House”.  Each self contained and completely private unit has been upgraded to the highest standards and redesigned with their own unique characteristics. This unit features a converted temperature controlled cistern basement. Formerly used by its residents to collect rain water for cooking and bathing, it now provides easy access to beach chairs, a boogie board, an ironing board and enfant high chair. The main building as well as each unit are accessed via electronic key pads, so no keys are required. The property consists of 3 buildings one of which was formerly a horse barn. Built above today's current downtown formerly known to residents as “New Town”  it is surrounded by Historic buildings of the period.

neighborhood_overview: The proximity of this property to all of the best that San Diego has to offer is very compelling. It's location in a historic district above downtown offers easy access to the energy of the city, beaches and airport while offering privacy and easy parking.
transit: Bus transit stops are located in and out of downtown within a half block of property on both sides of Market St. Access to 2 major freeways are located within 1 minute driving to of property.
access: Front Porch Table and Chairs Lighted Gazebo with Large Table and Chairs Barbecue Fire Pit Laundry Facility
interaction: Our guests are kept informed from the moment a reservation request is made until the end of their stay with us. We are always available to answer questions or provide insights into events and activities in San Diego and the surrounding areas.
host_about: For the last 25 years I have been involved in virtually every aspect of the real estate business and have spent years lovingly restoring this building which long ago became a labor of love. I have a beautiful wife and 3 wonderful young sons who love to visit the property and climb every available staircase. I personally built, designed and decorated each unit so it is my hope that you enjoy your stay as much as I have enjoyed creating a warm and quality environment. Earlier in my life I worked and traveled extensively with a global air carrier and experienced some of the most beautiful hotels around the world. That experience proved invaluable in allowing me to visualize and create beautiful interior spaces and designs. I will do my utmost to ensure your stay in San Diego  is comfortable and fulfilling. Your feedback is always welcome in an ongoing and continual effort to enhance and improve your current and future stays. I am very hands on when assistance is requested by our guests while doing my utmost to respect their privacy.  My wife is from Osaka so we travel to Japan on a fairly regular basis. She of course speaks Japanese fluently and is happy to respond to any of our Japanese guests. My children's nationalities are Japanese, Italian, French, Spanish, Irish and American, otherwise known as Earthlings. My wife and I look forward to resuming our favored recreational past time of Scuba Diving in the South Pacific as soon as our sons are old enough to join us.

summary: This airy, contemporary, newly-decorated town home boasts magnificent ocean and sunset views from multiple levels and is just one block from spectacular Windansea Beach.

Enjoy spectacular ocean views from the bright and spacious living room as well as the lofted master bedroom. A queen size bed in the master bedroom, one king bed in the second bedroom and one queen bed in the third bedroom as well as a queen sofa sleeper allow eight people to comfortably share this lovely space. neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

This is a well manicured neighborhood with most folks hiring gardeners, cleaners and other regular services to maintain appearances.

name: Downtown Loft Getaway
summary: Perfect, spacious New York Style loft in the heart of downtown San Diego! One block away from Gaslamp District, Trolley station and the most popular bars, clubs, and restaurants
space: Welcome to the most beautiful city in the Nation! From the city to the surf and everywhere in-between! Take an opportunity to live in a spacious loft in the heart of San Diego. You could not choose a better spot for a getaway. The loft is a one-bedroom (studio style with no doors), one bath inside a small complex of eight units. Features inside the loft include a hardwood-floor kitchen, brand new carpeting, ceiling-to-floor windows to get a view of the city, and an unusually long hallway at the entrance of the loft. Sleeping, for up to 6, includes a queen-size bed, a futon, and a queen-size air mattress.  Free Wifi is available inside the apartment.  TV with a DVD player and HDMI cable to connect to your laptop (unfortunately, no cable) Coin-operated laundry facility on the top floor (in the common area) but I have provided free laundry detergent!  AC/Heater (subject to restrictions)

neighborhood_overview: Being in the heart of downtown makes your getaway much easier! You are one block away from the Gaslamp Quarter--the site of several entertainment and night life venues. Endless restaurants, cafes, clubs, bars, and stores are located either on this block or just a few blocks away. World famous San Diego Zoo is a short cab ride away!  Five to ten minute cab/uber ride from the airport.  I have provided numerous brochures, coupons, maps, and sightseeing spots in the living room.  Petco Park, home of the San Diego Padres, is also walking distance!
notes: Please be mindful of the location--so expect normal city noises. This is a standard San Diego loft so the windows do not have blinds installed. There are curtains covering two of the windows but not in the living room. Please consider this if morning sunshine bothers you.
transit: The loft is a few steps away from the Trolley station and walking distance from the main train station (brochures provided to show the different train lines and routes). Just about everything you need is a few blocks (or less) away from the loft.  For other ways to travel around town, Uber is the way to go--cheap and almost always ready to pick up within a few minutes!  Street parking available.
access: Cute little courtyard (roof deck) one door down from the unit to sit back and relax under the San Diego sun.
interaction: I live ten minutes away so please contact me if you need anything! I can also provide suggestions for restaurants, clubs/bars, or sightseeing spots if you need.
house_rules: Please treat this home as if it were your own--by leaving it the same way as it was before you checked in :)  **The loft temperature is set at a specific degree. The temperature cannot be adjusted without prior approval from the owner or an additional fee may be incurred** (In other words, please contact me before adjusting)  Balcony access is not permitted per building rules. It will look accessible but guests may not step on the ledge. Host will not be liable for injuries resulting from prohibited balcony use.  No smoking inside Please be courteous of the neighbors and keep the noise level at a moderate level.  No pets

name: Lovely Pacific Beach Apartment 3 Blocks to Beach
summary: This beautiful vacation apartment is a new listing and ready for guests! It features two bedrooms- both with Queen beds, one bathroom, comfy living room and fully outfitted kitchen. All new furniture with attractive beach inspired decor. Walking distance to both the beach and local restaurants and bars. Easily accommodates 2-4 people plus one additional person on provided twin air bed. Parking space included. (Adult guests and children 10 and older only.)
space: If you're looking for a relaxing San Diego getaway look no further!   This comfortable ground floor vacation apartment is located just 3 blocks away from the beach!  It's positioned at the very north part of Pacific Beach, a relaxed beach community approximately 10 miles north of downtown San Diego. It is on the border of scenic La Jolla. Walk just a few blocks to the beach and you will hit the famous Tourmaline Surf Park, known for its ideal year-round waves and long rolling ride. Whether you surf or not the shoreline is gorgeous and the beach beckons to all. Nearby is Mission Bay, a relaxing sail bay with a calm atmosphere. With year-round comfortable outdoor temperatures and layed back beach vibe you will find it the ideal getaway.   This beautiful vacation apartment is beach themed, clean, and ready for guests!  The apartment is newly renovated (June 2016) with new counter tops, sink, tile work, dishwasher, flooring, and all new furniture and decor. The space features two bedrooms,
description: This beautiful vacation apartment is a new listing and ready for guests! It features two bedrooms- both with Queen beds, one bathroom, comfy living room and fully outfitted kitchen. All new furniture with attractive beach inspired decor. Walking distance to both the beach and local restaurants and bars. If you're looking for a relaxing San Diego getaway look no further!   This comfortable ground floor vacation apartment is located just 3 blocks away from the beach!  It's positioned at the very north part of Pacific Beach, a relaxed beach community approximately 10 miles north of downtown San Diego. It is on the border of scenic La Jolla. Walk just a few blocks to the beach and you will hit the famous Tourmaline Surf Park, known for its ideal year-round waves and long rolling ride. Whether you surf or not the shoreline is gorgeous and
neighborhood_overview: One of the nicest parts of this part of Pacific Beach is although this is prominently a residential neighborhood, how many cafes, coffee shops, restaurants, and bars are within walking distance from the apartment. There is a really good brunch place called the Fig Tree cafe just around the corner and several very popular restaurants and bars just a few blocks away.   If your main interest is spending time at the beach and hitting the local restaurants and bars you may not need a car at all. All of these can be found on Cass Street, Turquoise Street, Mission Blvd, or Garnet Streets in Pacific Beach. You can walk or rent a bike to get get around to most places within Pacific Beach.
notes: The surfing is fantastic at Tourmaline Beach for beginners to the advanced surfer and great for the spectator as well. We can recommend one-on-one surf lessons or a group class that are offered daily on the beach if you our the kids are interested in learning.   If you're an experienced surfer, my husband is an avid surfer and has lived here for 25 years so he knows all the surf breaks. He can point you to all the best surf spots in San Diego County.   The apartment is thoroughly cleaned between each stay. However if you are doing a rental longer than one week and you wish for a cleaning and change of linens we can arrange for the maid to come clean the apartment and change the linens during your stay for an additional charge of 100.  Past Guest discount is available for returning guests. Inquire for details.
transit: To orient you here are some distances from the apartment: 4 miles to Sea World 4 miles to La Jolla Cove 7 miles to Historic Old Town 10 miles to San Diego Airport 11.5 miles to San Diego Zoo/Balboa Park 12 miles to Gaslamp Quarter Riding bikes along the boardwalk is usually the most scenic way to get around and take in the beach atmosphere. The boardwalk begins just a few blocks south of Tourmaline Street at Law Street and continues all the way through Mission Beach past the big wooden roller coaster at Belmont Park. Bike rentals are available by the day or the week at Ray's Rentals nearby. If you decide to check out the nightlife downtown in the Gaslamp District we recommend taking an Uber cab so you don't have to deal with finding parking.  Uber cars are readily available for local transport at an affordable rate. If you've never used this service before download the phone app and use this code to get your first ride free (up to 15): janetb397.
access: One covered parking space is included with the rental located behind the building. Please let us know in advanced if you plan to use the space. Additional cars will park on the street. Neighborhood parking is generally plentiful during the daytime.  A key to the laundry room is provided in case you wish to do laundry during your stay. We provide laundry detergent for your use under the kitchen sink.
interaction: My husband and I are your hosts and we have an office two blocks away and live nearby. We will be available to answer questions during your stay. We provide you with our cell phone numbers for texting or calling if any questions or needs arise. And we can easily come by and assist you with anything you need. (There is also an onsite manager if there are any emergencies.)
house_rules: All guests must be 10 years of age and older.  Please note the space is NOT baby proof and is NOT appropriate for young children under 10 years of age.  This is NOT to be rented as a party house.  This is a quiet neighborhood and is generally pretty quiet at night. Quiet hours are 10 pm until 9 am. No underage drinking allowed on the premises. The neighbors all have our phone number and if they call us to complain about any noise issues or excessive people arriving we will kick you out immediately. (Airbnb does allow hosts to remove guests who do not follow our published house rules.)  Please note, this is strictly a non-smoking rental. If you are a smoker this may not be the right place for you. You may NOT smoke inside or outside on the patio. If we smell any smoke in the apartment when you leave we will keep your deposit plus charge you any additional cleaning fees to get the smoke smell out.  We require the names of all of the registered guests upon booking. There are to be no over
host_about:
Hi my name is Janet and I am from Southern California. I live on the beach in San Diego with my husband Scott and my dog Blossom, a chocolate Labrador retriever.  My husband and I absolutely love being AirBnb hosts and find delight in sharing the beautiful area where we live!  

We make every effort to make sure you feel relaxed and comfortable during your stay and that you get the most out of your time while in San Diego, whether that means sightseeing around town or just chilling out on the beach. We have figured out the delicate balance of mingling and getting to know our guests, while giving them their space and privacy in their own guest house.  We are available when you need us. Let us know if you have any special needs or requests and we will do what we can to accommodate you.

With AirBnb, we've found all of our guests to be delightful people. We will welcome you as friends and look forward to showing you our bit of paradise on the beach!

host_about:
Hi! 
I'm Rachel, I love the beach and playing sports.  I'm a great cook, love to read and watch movies.  I'm easy going, relaxed and friendly and I'm looking forward to having you stay here in one of our beautiful homes in America's Finest City!  We enjoy hosting long term and short term stays and have several different size homes located throughout the county. We are sure to have something available that suits your needs.  We are glad to have you stay and do our best to make you comfortable, and are on call for anything you need during your trip!

My husband says I should open a restaurant to showcase all of his favorites of my cooking. neighborhood_overview: San Diego is known for its year-round sunny skies, pleasant temperatures, and beautiful beaches. And right in the middle of it all, WorldMark San Diego - Balboa Park is ready to host you in one of the greatest cities in California. Your downtown, art deco–style resort consists of 68 units that are either studios or one-bedrooms units. The five-story completely renovated property was built in 1928. While you're here, walk over to the historical and always lively Gaslamp Quarter (.5 miles away) for dinner in one of Fifth Avenue’s hot spots, such as Rei Do Gado, Croce’s, or, if you really want to splurge, The Fish Market. You may want to block off some time for Balboa Park—only .25 miles from the resort. The park is akin to San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park or New York City’s Central Park and is, in fact, the nation’s largest urban cultural park, coming in at 1,174 acres. summary: Our San Diego home is centrally located in the Heart of North Park, 3 blocks north of the Historical Morley Field section of Balboa Park.  We provide a private master BR with queen bed and private bath.
space: Our San Diego home is centrally located in the Heart of North Park, 3 blocks north of the Historical Morley Field section of Balboa Park. We are within walking distance to HIP Neighborhood of North Park, just 3 and a half blocks from the bustling University Ave to the North, and 2 and a half blocks to Balboa Park to the South. Just one block to public transportation, many of the major attractions are easy to access. Our home is five miles from the airport. The SD Zoo, Balboa Park museums, Sea World, Petco Park, Gas Lamp Quarter, Old Town, USS Midway, San Diego Harbor, shopping malls and beaches are nearby. We are less than 4 miles from the Convention Center. North Park is a friendly community of great restaurants, ice cream, coffee houses, shops, art, entertainment and microbreweries. neighborhood_overview: Get ready for an experience, a true San Diego adventure, of exploring the diverse culture of our historic neighborhoods. Our home is a California Craftsman Bungalow built in 1913 and retains most of its original character.  Just 3 and a half blocks from the bustling University Ave to the North, and 2 and a half blocks to Balboa Park to the South.  Come and go as you please, without fear of disturbing anyone. Just one block to public transportation, many of the major attractions are easy to access. Our home is five miles from the airport. The SD Zoo, Balboa Park museums, Sea World, Petco Park, Gas Lamp Quarter, Old Town, USS Midway, San Diego Harbor, shopping malls and beaches are nearby. We are less than 4 miles from the Convention Center.  North Park is a friendly community of great restaurants, ice cream, coffee houses, shops, art, entertainment and microbreweries. Eat and shop local at the North Park Farmer's Market on Thursdays…4 blocks away. North Park is a Fun Hip Neighborhood, v
notes: We have an orange Taby Cat than can be temperamental, but for the most part is just inquisitive….like most cats. He is not allowed in your room or the private bath.  Wireless Internet and Cable TV are in your room. The extensive back patio, walkways and yard are private to the home with high fences for privacy.  There is No Smoking allowed in the house, the patio or the room.  The only smoking area will be out front of the house on the sidewalk.  We are both non-smokers.  We look forward to having you as a guest.  Please ask questions or tell us if something isn't right. We strive to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.
transit: There are several public transit options that are easy to access. If you are driving, there is plenty of free street parking and easy access to several main freeways (you can be at the beach in 12 minutes). Also there is quick access to downtown right through the park on Pershing Drive (10 minutes). Uber or car2go options are readily available. We are 3 blocks from nearest Deco Bike Rental Station (@ North Park Way and 30th Streets).  City bus, taxi and trolley are easy to use in San Diego. Public transportation via the city bus is located 1 block away. Take the city bus to the trolley station, Santa Fe Train Depot, or downtown to get on a ferry and cruise across the harbor to explore Coronado. Our home is walking distance to all North Park has to offer.
access: Our guests have a private bedroom with queen bed, cable TV, and WIFI. You will find towels, toiletries, closet space, a dresser and a mirror. You will also have access to all common rooms; living room, kitchen, dining room, and the front and back patios.  The kitchen is open for light cooking only. Help yourself to a cup of coffee or tea.  Feel free to sit on the front porch and catch the North Park vibe.  In addition to the private master bed room and private bath, there is plenty of guest parking on the street right in front of the house or in our driveway should space permit.
interaction: Your host Mike and Steve will be glad to provide any information and support. Our home is clean, quiet and has a friendly atmosphere.  As we are avid collectors, there is always something to keep your attention as you cozy up for a good read or to watch TV.  We are available to help as little or as much as needed with questions and suggestions. We respect your needs as a guest.
house_rules: Simple basics:  1.  Please be mindful of others in the house when coming in late at night.  2.  Only registered guests are allowed in the house unless discussed and agreed upon.  3.  No smoking in the house.

Petco park is 9 blocks away Sherman Heights right next to East Village in Downtown San Diego is a residential community with historic Victorian homes. This location is a quieter environment but just minutes from the Convention Center, Gas Lamp district, Coronado & Airport. Easy Freeway, Trolley and Bus Line Access.
notes: We have a dog and a cat. They are both really sweet and shy. Our dog never barks or bites. Just be aware if you aren't an animal lover or allergic.
transit: Easy Freeway, Trolley and Bus Line Access. There is a bus stop across the street. We are very close to east village and downtown, within walking distance to many bars and restaurants.  We also have two bikes you may use. There is street parking for cars. Uber, lyft and car2go are also great options for transportation.
access: You'll have access to a shared bathroom, living room and kitchen. We'll have breakfast items you're welcome to have. There's a shared washer and dryer that's coin operated.
interaction: We work at home most weekdays so we'll be here to help you with anything you may need throughout your stay, but we may also be working from out of the house also and you'll be able to contact us if you need anything.
house_rules: Feel free to make yourself at home, relax on the patio and ask for any recommendations (coffee, pizza, tacos, etc) all within walking distance. Simple breakfasts will be provided. No smoking please.

neighborhood_overview: Small village-beach appeal with authentic owner-operated restaurants, featuring Parisian style outdoor dining (no late night noise).  All La Jolla destinations within minutes drive or even better a leisurely bike ride or walk.
notes: La Jolla Shores and San Diego in general has a great year around climate of 72 degrees with nice a breeze. Winter nights cool into the low 60's. There is never a bad time of year to vacation here. Water temperature in summer 70-73 degrees and 59-65 in winter. Use of a wetsuit makes it year round for surfing, kayaking and paddle boarding. Torrey Pines Golf Course 10 minutes and has great views of the ocean. Balboa Park is great for all types of Museums as well as La Jolla Contemporary Art. host_about:
I rent out my WorldMark timeshare -- 120+ resort locations all over the US, Mexico, Canada, Australia, Fiji, New Zealand, and England.

My specialty is last-minute short-stay accommodations, but please be smart about your expectations: if it's less than a month before any kind of holiday, concert, or event, it's likely already booked up. Accommodations in Indio and Palms Springs sell out within an HOUR of Coachella tickets going on sale* but it's the same two weekends every year, so be smart about it. Holidays and summer weekends also book up far in advance. 

You can book as far as 13 months out.

*If you book more than 10 months out, there is a 7-night minimum.

If you want to book a Friday or a Saturday, there is a three-night minimum -- unless you are booking within 48 hours of check-in (4pm)

I have units that can accommodate as many as eight people. Have more than eight? You can rent more that one unit! The Maximum Occupancy listed on the listing is as true as gravity and cannot be altered with because the Fire Marshal said so. Respect the Fire Marshal's wisdom.

Almost all units have a complete kitchen. In addition to full-size appliances, you'll find plates, glasses, silverware, and other kitchen items. All linens, including towels, are included. You have access to all resort amenities -- that means the pool, the hot tub, the gym, free parking, etc.

Sadly, the resorts do not allow pets.

Wifi is 4.95/day or 15.95/stay. This is 100% a resort fee that I have 0% control over.

This is a timeshare. Someone at the resort might (but probably won't) try to talk you into buying a timeshare. They'll even give you a present if you say yes! Saying yes means dealing with them for the next two hours, and that's *not* why you went on vacation. BE SMART - SAY NO - GO ENJOY YOUR VACATION! :)

We've had too many bad experiences with guests from Orange County, California. If you are a current or former resident of Orange County and would like to rent from us, kindly be kind in your messages; we'll get the hint that you're a decent person and will welcome you with open arms.

***Feel good about your vacation! A portion of every rental fee goes to help purchase clothing, shoes, school supplies, medical supplies, and nutritious food for children through Children International. Learn more about Children International and consider sponsoring a child yourself!***

You can smoke on the side walk. • No Drugs: Please do not use drugs of any kind in this home! • No house parties: This home is set up to host 2 guests with no additional charge. This can call out unneeded attention/noise complaints from the neighbors, parking issues and have a negative impact on the ability to rent this home in the future.  • Cleanliness: Please treat this home with r
host_about:
I have been an avid traveler for years. I stumbled upon airbnb in 2014 and fell in love with that idea of staying in the comfort in someones home instead of staying in a expensive Hotel. I loved it so much, I decided to try it in my own homes. Needless to say, I fell in love with hosting and entertaining people from all over the world! I look forward to hopefully doing the same for you during your travels! :) 

I have been a SUPER HOST on Airbnb since the program rolled out in early 2015.  Hosting 700+ guests over the 2015 year. You might be wondering what a Super Host is? A Super Host has to meet a strict criteria set in place by Airbnb. Airbnb does a assessment 4x a year (each quarter) to see if we have met the criteria for that quarter.  

My Host Mission:

1. Deliver 5 Star service 100% of the time to guests!
2. Offer a clean, safe and well organized home.
3. Offer value based pricing saving you  while giving you more!

I look forward to meeting you soon!  

Cheers, 
Greg

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 3,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

neighborhood_overview: Carmel Valley is a vibrant, culturally-rich society area located in one of the most comfortable climates in the world. The nearly perfect year-round temperatures make outdoor recreation and entertainment a huge part of the luxury lifestyle you'll find in the San Diego area. Nestled conveniently at the intersection of I-5, I 56 and I-805, immediately north of La Jolla's “Golden Triangle" and University of California at San Diego, Del Mar, Rancho Santa FE, Santa Luz, Carmel Valley offers quick access to major thoroughfares, desirable commercial zones, and outstanding parks. San Diego boasts more biodiversity than any other county in the nation and a great place to experience that remarkable display is San Diego's parks and gardens. San Diego's steep and varied topography combined with its proximity to the ocean create five different habitats within the county including tidal, marsh, desert, mountains and canyons. Each area offers visitors a chance to get outside and experience Southern C

transit: One of the wildest stretches of land on the Southern California coast, the Torrey Pines State Natural Reserve Park is dedicated to preserving its namesake, the Torrey Pine tree and other indigenous wildlife in its native environment. A coastal wilderness of pine forests and sandstone canyons, the park offers hiking trails that wind their way along the cliffs, offering breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean, and the seasonal sighting of migrating whales.  Just south of Torrey Pines in the Cabrillo National Monument Historic Park, commemorating the landing of Juan Rodriguez Cabrillo at San Diego Bay in 1542, the first European explorer to set foot on the West Coast of the United States. Appart from the historic significance, the park offers amazing views of San Diego's harbor and skyline, as well as Coronado and Naval Air Station North Island. Just below the monument, the stretch of coast here offers some of the best tide pools for exploring on the West Coast.  If water sports are your

Winter nights cool into the low 60's. There is never a bad time of year to vacation here. Water temperature in summer 70-73 degrees and 59-65 in winter. Use of a wetsuit makes it year round for surfing, kayaking and paddle boarding.  Torrey Pines Golf Course has great views of the ocean. Balboa Park is great for all types of Museums as well as La Jolla Contemporary Art. For Families Sea World and San Diego Zoo and LEGOLAND are a must. Disneyland is 1.5 hour drive from San Diego.  The area around h
transit: All modes of transportation available including taxi service, car rentals, and public transportation. We are also conveniently located to the bus stop (e.g., 41, 921). The bus is inexpensive (2.5) for one ride and will take you to and from UCSD, downtown San Diego, etc.  You can also walk to many nice restaurants and shopping mall. Starbucks, Einstein Bagels, European Deli, Regents Pizzeria, Mexican, Nozomi Sushi restaurant and others can be reached by foot from the house.
access: You have complete access to the entire house. Two complimentary car parking spaces are available in front of the house (one covered and one not). The apartment is yours privately during your stay. You also have access to the community park and swimming pools/jaccuzi, which is perfect for a vacation day when you don't want to head out too far.
interaction: From inquiry to your arrival we make sure to send you all the necessary information you will need to access the property. We automate the checkin process so you won't have to wait for us to let you in. Imagine as if you are coming back home and everything is ready for you.  You can call or text us anytime with questions or help with local attractions and provide tips and suggestions. We are always around if you need our assistance.
house_rules: Our neighborhood is full of amazing people just like yourself. We want to make sure everyone is comfortable therefore we kindly request that you keep noise levels to considerate levels.  Please be minded that our home is strictly nonsmoking. If you must smoke, we kindly request you to do it outside the house.  No partying or loud disturbances are allowed for the comfort of the neighbors. Please treat the house as if it was your own and keep it clean. To protect the flooring and reduce the amount of bacteria and allergens in the house, please take your shoes off. It also helps to keep a good feng-shui in the house.  Thank you for your kind cooperation.
host_about: My name is Kexi, and I'm a passionate software engineer. I spend lots of time in front of my laptop, coding and sipping tea. In my spare time, I usually read books, go shopping, or do some creative painting.

space: Extensively remodeled both inside and out, it is indeed the perfect vacation escape as it is designed for pure relaxation. neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 2,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations. Dogs allowed with 150 pet fee.

neighborhood_overview: Sitting in the backyard enjoying the birds in the day or the city lights view in the evening, or just walking around the neighborhood, is a relaxing experience. However, when you venture out... You're minutes to grocery stores including Vons, Trader Joe's, Sprouts, and Whole Foods. There is also a Starbucks just minutes away as well as a laundromat, dry cleaner, pharmacy, sushi bar, Italian restaurant, etc. We have a beautiful shopping mall (UTC Mall) just 5 minutes up the road which has a luxury movie theater, Nordstrom, Macys, Tiffanys, and other great stores. 15 minutes the other direction and you have another mall with shops including another Nordstrom, Bloomingdales, and Niemann Marcus. We are close to many local attractions: - Beaches: Pacific Beach, Mission Beach, La Jolla Shores, Torrey Pines, etc. - San Diego Zoo - San Diego Wild Animal Park - Sea World - La Jolla Village - La Jolla Cove - Downtown San Diego - Little Italy - Swami's for surfing - Torrey Pines State Park - Torr
notes: For allergy considerations, although there is one dog that lives on the premises, he is a breed considered non-allergenic. He will not be there during your stay if you rent the whole house.
transit: You'll have quick access to freeways heading east/west (SR52) and north/south (I-1 and I-805). At our place you are close to everything!
access: If you rent the room, you'll be sharing the space with us during your stay. You'll have access and use of everything except the garage. That includes the full kitchen, bathroom (we have our own), front and back yard, BBQ grill and any fruit on the fruit trees and herbs in the garden.  :)
interaction: We are happy to spend time chatting with guests to get them acquainted with the house and our great city. We can recommend things to do and places to eat. We enjoy the outdoors so we can give advice on recreational activities too! We always make ourselves available during your stay for questions.
house_rules: This is our primary residence and we hope you treat it like your own. No pets, no smoking, no parties, no additional visitors.
host_about:
We are a married couple (20 years) who has been together since college. Love animals and travel.  We are quiet, clean and respectful. I am an interior designer and Scott is a geologist. Our home is in San Diego.

We first used Airbnb for a trip up and down the California Coast (strongly recommended!). We had a wonderful experience. Since then we have opened our home to host. We have had great experiences with people from the US, Germany, UK, Austria, Spain, Cyprus, and China.

We also used Airbnb on a motorcycle tour of Northern Europe in 2013 and Greece/Turkey last summer. We've used Airbnb stayed in the Netherlands, Latvia, Estonia, Czech Republic, Greece, Turkey, Italy, and Germany. It was super helpful to be able to find accommodations in small towns where there we no good hotel options and in big cities where hotels were quite expensive. Everyone helped us find accommodations for our motorcycle too.

access: San Diego is known for its year-round sunny skies, pleasant temperatures, and beautiful beaches. And right in the middle of it all, WorldMark San Diego - Balboa Park is ready to host you in one of the greatest cities in California. Your downtown, art deco–style resort consists of 68 units that are either studios or one-bedrooms units. The five-story completely renovated property was built in 1928. While you're here, walk over to the historical and always lively Gaslamp Quarter (.5 miles away) for dinner in one of Fifth Avenue's hot spots, such as Rei Do Gado, Croce's, or, if you really want to splurge, The Fish Market. You may want to block off some time for Balboa Park—only .25 miles from the resort. The park is akin to San Francisco's Golden Gate Park or New York City's Central Park and is, in fact, the nation's largest urban cultural park, coming in at 1,174 acres. name: Charming Craftsman in South Park
summary: Enjoy time in a 100 year old craftsman style home located in the trendy neighborhood of South Park in the heart of San Diego.  Walk to restaurants, bars & shops or take public transit to the convention center, the Gaslamp, Petco Park & Little Italy.
space: Thank you for looking at my home!  Located on a beautiful large lot in the trendy South Park neighborhood the craftsman includes all the amenities you would need for a vacation away from home! There is plenty of street parking in front without the hassle of moving for street sweepers. The house includes a full kitchen, full bathroom, and three bedrooms. Two of the bedrooms have a comfortable queen size bed in each room. The smaller bedroom in the back is a cozy room with a twin size bed. The home is equipped with a television with cable television, dvd player, and wireless internet.  The home has a lovely living room area with plenty of windows to the yard and street. There is also a full dining room located near the kitchen that includes a wonderful reading nook. The large yard space is shared with the cottage in the back and is home to a vegetable garden, lush vegetation, hammock, eating space for 6, bbq grill, and hot tub (due to California drought and its age it is not always opera

Walk to restaurants, bars & shops or take public transit to the convention center, the Gaslamp, Petco Park & Little Italy. Thank you for looking at my home! The home is equipped with a television with cable television, dvd player, and wireless internet.  The home has a lovely living room area with plenty of windows to the yard and street. There is also a full dining room located near the kitchen that includes a
neighborhood_overview: My home is located in the beautiful neighborhood of South Park. Two blocks away are a couple of shops, a yoga studio, a boot camp facility, a fantastic deli (Grant's), Hamilton's bar, The South Park Brewing Company, and Buona Forchetta restaurant. (It was voted best Italian restaurant in San Diego in 2014). About a mile walk is the heart of South Park with boutique shops, a great burger place (The Station), and numerous other restaurants and bars. (At Rebecca's Coffeehouse you will see Rebecca making homemade scones to die for most mornings and The Big Kitchen is where Whoopie Goldberg got her start as a dishwasher!)  The majority of the homes in South Park are over 100 years old and most are in the Craftsman style of architecture. You will find historically registered homes on nearly every street in this small neighborhood.  It's a great walking neighborhood.
notes: Sunshine (My therapy dog): Sunshine typically goes to work with me but at times you will see her coming and going in the yard.  She is a golden-doodle (golden retriever/poodle mix) and is very friendly though she will likely bark at you at first.  Just call her by name and let her smell you before you try to pet her and you'll be best buds! If you are uncomfortable with her please let me know and I can make sure we are more diligent about her being out in the yard unsupervised during your stay. She is a non-shedding, hypo-allergenic dog so even if you have allergies you should not have any problems with allergic reactions.
transit: The number 2 bus will take you downtown in 13 minutes, you can often rent car2go in the neighborhood or you can rent bikes through DecoBike throughout South Park.  Uber and Lyft are other inexpensive and easily accessible alternatives.
access: While the house opens up to the backyard and grill area this is a shared space between the cottage and small guest house across the backyard. Our guests are welcome to use this space as much as they would like, however please know you will likely see other guests as well as us coming and going through here. There is a hot tub on the property that is only for the use of the main house guests.  Unfortunately, due to the severe water shortage in California I have been unable to drain, clean and refill it as often so please ask if it is available during your stay.
interaction: Due to my busy work schedule and the chauffeuring duties for my active teenager I may not have much face-to-face contact with my guests. However, I am always available via airbnb or text/email. You may see any number of my family members from time to time: daughters (4 total but only 1 still living at home) within the shared spaces and we will always say hello and help you with anything you may need while you are here. We will also not bother you.
house_rules: This is a residential area so please be quiet when you come in late at night and please no late night noise after 10pm.  If you must smoke please do so outside and dispose of the trash.   Without debating whether certain drugs should be legalized or not please respect the fact that not only do I have a teenage daughter living on the premises, but that I am also a licensed professional and would never risk  jeopardizing this license.  So No drugs are allowed on the premises. Please make sure the gate always latches behind you. (It’s been temperamental lately) Sunshine is very smart and will sneak out if it’s not latched.   The house key will lock the gate and often our guests keep it locked if they are gone for the day or in the evening for extra security. No outside guests without prior knowledge. Treat my house as you would like yours to be treated. NO DOGS PERMITTED without discussing with Joy first. There may be one dog in the yard during your stay.  If this is a problem, please let
host_about:
"People never regret things that the DID do...only what they never did" 


Hi, I'm Joy..I live in the main house with my teenage daughter and our two Goldendoodle's- Sunshine and our new puppy Keegan. (The cottage is in the backyard.) I work most days as a psychologist in my private practice in South Park and two days a week I work with military dependents in a school setting.  When I'm not working I love being a mom, working in my garden, playing tennis and going to the gym while dreaming about my next travel adventure!  I love meeting people and have often been accused of speaking to every person that I pass on the street.  We have hosted foreign exchange students for the past 14 years and have made several trips to Europe to visit some of them.  I am from Oklahoma and have been raised to show my Southern hospitality so I hope you enjoy my cottage.

neighborhood_overview: Fun and funky North Park started coming into its own early in the new millennium.  When a check-cashing store changed over to a dessert restaurant, local residents knew something was happening.  New restaurants are still opening monthly, and the neighborhood has become home to hipsters from all walks of life.  But don't take my word for it.  Even the New York Times has written about all the good things going on in this neighborhood! + Bi-Weekly Free Summer Concerts at Nearby Bird Park. + The North Park Farmer's Market is every Thursday evening from 3 - 7pm on North Park Way at Herman Street. + Ray At Night artwalk just up the street is every month on the second Saturday night, from 6-10pm.  Art and free live music in a festive setting. + Critical Mass bicycle ride leaves from nearby Balboa Park at the water fountain off Park Blvd., 7pm on the last Friday of each month. + Annual Toyland parade every December Guided tours of homes and buildings in North Park by North Park Main Street org
notes: * The homes in this area are relatively close together:  It is imperative guests respect quiet and privacy for our neighbors.  We enforce quiet hours between 10pm and 8am. * This rental is for overnight accommodations ONLY:  No house parties, special events, or media production permitted. * We welcome inquiries for stays up to 4 months.  For stays one month or longer, the security deposit is 2000.   For stays 3 months or longer, the security deposit is 2500.
transit: + We are perfectly located 3 blocks from North Park's active epicenter - close enough to walk to, but far enough for evening quiet and available street parking.  (See Guidebook) + Two stop signs and one traffic from downtown (5 minutes).  Downtown 5 minutes away by car, Airport 15 minutes away. + Minutes from San Diego's famous San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park. + Bus lines to downtown and crosstown 3 blocks away. + Taxi waiting station nearby.

Originally from New York, I'm a multi-media artist who loves to travel, take pix, meet people, and continue learning about the world.  Hosting my second home to visitors has totally added to that.  I love living in San Diego and really like sharing my city with others by hosting them and making suggestions around here according to their needs.

As a traveler, I like to take leisurely ride bikes to explore, visit contemporary art museums, take in the architecture, sample interesting sounds, explore with my camera, and of course meet the local people.

neighborhood_overview: San Diego is known for its year-round sunny skies, pleasant temperatures, and beautiful beaches. And now, right in the middle of it all, WorldMark San Diego - Mission Valley is ready to host you in one of the greatest cities in California.  Your new resort—located in the quiet San Diego suburb of Mission Valley—consists of 167 one- and two-bedroom units, each with a fully equipped kitchen. Resort amenities include a pool, spa, exercise facility, and free underground parking. You may want to block off some time for Balboa Park—only 4.5 miles from the resort. The park is akin to San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park or New York City’s Central Park and is, in fact, the nation’s largest urban cultural park, coming in at 1,174 acres. neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

name: Private Ocean Beach Cottage
summary: Our bright and comfy one bedroom/ one bath beach cottage is the perfect place to enjoy Ocean Beach and San Diego.  It is conveniently located three blocks down the street from the beach with a full kitchen, full bathroom and private courtyard.
space: Our cottage is nestled on the quiet residential end of Newport Avenue which gives you a three block stroll past the shops and restaurants on your way to the beach.  It's tucked behind the front house with it's own gated courtyard including a charcoal BBQ and patio table set.  Currently, the courtyard is growing with wildflowers and has a raised bed vegetable garden and compost. The space is light and bright with bamboo floors and double pane windows.  The cottage has: * One bedroom with Queen size adjustable Temperpedic memory foam bed. * Futon in front room folds down to a full size bed with comfy memory foam mattress. * Kitchen has a gas stove, refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. * Fully equipped with utensils, bowls, plates, mugs, and wine glasses. * Dining table seats four. * Bath with tub and shower. * Flat screen TV with Netflix, Pandora * Wireless internet. * Ceiling fan in both the bedroom and the front room. * Linens, bath towels, and beach towels provided. * Beach crui
description: Our bright and comfy one bedroom/ one bath beach cottage is the perfect place to enjoy Ocean Beach and San Diego.  It is conveniently located three blocks down the street from the beach with a full kitchen, full bathroom and private courtyard.  Our cottage is nestled on the quiet residential end of Newport Avenue which gives you a three block stroll past the shops and restaurants on your way to the beach.  It's tucked behind the front house with it's own gated courtyard including a charcoal BBQ and patio table set.  Currently, the courtyard is growing with wildflowers and has a raised bed vegetable garden and compost. The space is light and bright with bamboo floors and double pane windows.  The cottage has: * One bedroom with Queen size adjustable Temperpedic memory foam bed. * Futon in front room folds down to a full size bed with comfy memory foam mattress. * Kitchen has a gas stove, refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. * Fully equipped with utensils, bowls, plates, mugs, and
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is situated at the quiet residential end of Newport Avenue so it's just out of the way from the hustle and bustle. But it's only a half a block away from the best shops and restaurants as you make the three block walk to the beach. There's an elementary school across the street so you may hear kids playing during the day but most of the time you won't notice its there.  Ocean Beach also sits close to the San Diego airport which means you can hear some of the louder planes that fly overhead. The airport has a curfew starting at 11:30pm at night and ending at 6:30am in the morning so light sleepers will likely hear the first flights in the morning. Most people aren't bothered by the airplanes and the cottage has double pane windows to keep things pretty quiet inside.
notes: As mentioned before, Ocean Beach sits close to the San Diego airport which means light  sleepers will likely hear the first flights in the morning beginning at 6:30am.  Also, the front house is home to our friends/tenants who have a friendly chihuahua/daschund who stays inside most of the day and doesn't bark much. You may meet her in the front yard if she comes out to play so please be mindful to keep the front gate closed. The back courtyard gate will keep her out of your way if you so choose.    Our Transient Occupancy certificate number is #610821.
transit: Ocean Beach is a small beach town and the cottage is centrally located to be able to walk to all the best restaurants, shops and most importantly the beach.  There are a couple bus lines a block away that can take you downtown or to other parts of San Diego, but the public transportation in San Diego isn't the most convenient.  The airport is very convenient by taxi. Another cool option that we like is Car2Go which offers a very convenient car sharing program for short trips to downtown or nearby sites, although this requires a little pre-planning because you have to sign up for a membership ahead of time if you don't already have one.  We also have a couple older beach cruiser bicycles that are available upon request.
access: After passing through the front yard and walkway of the front house, you'll enter your own gated courtyard and find the red door of our back cottage. Keyless entry lock so you won't have to worry about keys, we'll give you your own code. Behind the cottage is a garage which we use for storage and laundry but you'll also find a hot/cold outdoor shower for a refreshing rinse after the beach. There's also alley access behind the garage if you don't want to walk past the front house. Feel free to park in the parking spot behind the garage since finding parking on the street can sometimes be difficult. The entire property is surrounded by a wooden fence for privacy and security.
interaction: We're happy to provide any level of interaction you prefer.  Our friends and long term tenants live in the front house and you may meet them out and about on the property, but we live just up the the street so just let us know if you need anything at all to help make your stay more enjoyable.
house_rules: While we love dogs, unfortunately we don't allow them at our listing. We kindly ask that you inform us of any guest that will be staying the night.   We also ask that you not light any candles while visiting and there is absolutely NO SMOKING or parties allowed on the property in consideration of our neighbors.
host_about: We're a young couple, an engineer and a nurse, who love to travel.  We also love our town of Ocean Beach and are happy to share it with those who wish to visit.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

Ample, free street parking.  *Please Note:  This rental is for overnight accommodations only; no house parties, special events, or media production permitted.
space: Characterized by quiet privacy and open spaciousness, the indoor fireplace and high ceilings of this studio make it feel like a romantic cabin or loft.  The sunken, modular living area opens up to a private sculpture garden with fire pit table and seating.  All the conveniences of home include a full kitchen, large refrigerator, gas range, microwave, dvd, tv and wi-fi.  Queen size bed and futon sofa that folds into a twin bed for a third guest.  Discount priced for week-long and month-long stays.

neighborhood_overview: Fun and funky North Park started coming into its own early in the new millennium.  When a check-cashing store changed over to a dessert restaurant, local residents knew something was happening.  New restaurants are still opening, and the neighborhood has become home to hipsters from all walks of life.  But don't take my word for it.  Even the New York Times has written about all the good things going on in this neighborhood! + The North Park Farmer's Market is every Thursday evening from 3 - 7pm on North Park Way at Herman Street. + Ray At Night artwalk just up the street is every month on the second Saturday night, from 6-10.  Art and free live music in a festive setting. + Critical Mass bicycle ride leaves from nearby Balboa Park at the water fountain off Park Blvd., around 7pm on the last Friday of each month. + Annual Toyland parade every December Guided tours of homes and buildings in North Park by North Park Main Street organization. + See the San Diego Reader North Park section
notes: * Please Note:  This rental is for overnight accommodations only; no house parties, special events, or media production permitted. * We welcome inquiries for stays up to 4 months.  For stays 1-2 months, the deposit is 500.  For 3 months or longer, the security deposit is 1000.
transit: + Located adjacent to North Park's central district at 30th & University - walk to bars, restaurants, and coffee houses, art galleries, shops and performance venues.  (See guide) + Two stop signs and one traffic from downtown (5 minutes).  Downtown 5 minutes away by car, Airport 15 minutes away. + Minutes from San Diego's famous San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park. + Bus lines to downtown and crosstown 3 blocks away. + Taxi waiting station nearby.
access: Top 10 Reasons to Choose this Vacation Home!: 1)  This is a dedicated vacation rental.  You won't have to deal with other people's "stuff". 2)  Quiet, Convenient Location close to Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, Downtown, and within 20 minutes to anywhere in metro San Diego. 3)  Walking Distance to Restaurants, Bars, Coffee Shops, Yoga Studios, and other Venues (See Guidebook).  Bus Stops nearby. 4)  Costs a Fraction of Staying at the Beach (only 15 minutes away).  Use the Savings for your airfare! 5)  Open, multi-level floor plan can be customized to your needs with moveable furniture and curtains. 6)  Private sculpture garden with fire pit table and Adirondack Chairs. 7)  Bright Sunny Bathroom with deep Bathtub to soak in. 8)  Conveniences like HDTV, Free Wi-Fi and Streaming Movies,  Desk, Music Console, and a Charging Station for your Devices and Free Street Parking, and 24 Hour Access for Late Arrivals. 9)  Starter Breakfast Options, Tea and Coffee.  Wood Burning Fireplace with free 3
interaction: I always enjoy meeting fellow travelers, and prefer to greet them personally upon arrival.  As I have lived in San Diego for over 20 years and love living here, I really enjoy giving my guests recommendations on places to go and things to see.  I live about 10 minutes away for convenience, and am always available by text or phone.
house_rules: * Check in after 4pm.  Check out by 11am.  Please use lock box & text me when checking out. * Rental is for overnight accommodations only.  This home shall not be used for house parties, special events, or media production. * Quiet hours are from 10pm-8am.  Please respect your neighbors in the front house and surrounding properties. * Please keep excessive noise indoors by closing doors and windows when necessary. * Children shall be accompanied by adults at all times on the premises. * No smoking indoors * No pets * Save energy by turning off lights and keeping doors /windows closed when temperature control is on. * Cookware and dishes shall be clean, dry, and placed back in cupboards. * Trash shall be removed and put outside in the appropriate trash or recycling bins. * Guests more than the number booked will be charged 25 per guest per night or deducted from deposit.
host_about:
Originally from New York, I'm a multi-media artist who loves to travel, take pix, meet people, and continue learning about the world.  Hosting my second home to visitors has totally added to that.  I love living in San Diego and really like sharing my city with others by hosting them and making suggestions around here according to their needs.

As a traveler, I like to take leisurely ride bikes to explore, visit contemporary art museums, take in the architecture, sample interesting sounds, explore with my camera, and of course meet the local people.

I also offer photography lessons for groups or privately to help people understand their digital cameras better, compose pictures better, and have more fun taking them.  Perfect for travelers visiting San Diego!

neighborhood_overview: Golden Hill is one of San Diego's historic areas. My neighborhood is walking distance to Saturday morning farmers market, women's history museum, downtown, San Diego Zoo,  Balboa Park and access to most major freeways in San Diego. The area is also popular and known for being home to several churches, auto/ bicycle shops, coffee houses, popular new restaurants, grocery stores, taverns and wine bars, art galleries, a dog wash, golf course, a yoga, nail spa and fitness center. South Park retail and restaurant community is also within 20-25 minute walking distance or 5 minute route #2 bus ride to downtown. I enjoy the quarterly Walkabouts on Saturday evenings during March 19, July 9, October 08 and December 03. Shops are open late, live music, refreshments and a free trolley from Beech Street to Grape Street to Juniper Street (walking distance). Most convenient is the San Diego Market across the street. This market has a variety of adult beverages and meals for lunch or dinner. I enjoy th
notes: For those visiting San Diego this city has the perfect weather. In the last 3 years it has gotten warmer during the summer months.  The warm season lasts from July to October months with an average daily high temperature above 74°F. The hottest days of the year is in August, with an average high of 76°F and low of 67°F. The cold season lasts from December to April with an average daily high temperature below 67°F. The coldest days of the year is in December, with an average low of 49°F and high of 65°F.
transit: #2 City Bus, Decobike station, Free Street Parking, Uber pick up and drop off.
house_rules: We are incredibly easy-going and want to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Please feel free to ask us for any advice or if you have any questions about getting around San Diego. No smoking or pets inside the apartment. Clean, respectful guests are very much appreciated. I will do my best to respect your privacy but don't hesitate to contact me on any issues concerning the unit, the building, the area, the maid's cleaning or security issues.  There is a 100 security deposit, which helps to ensure the condo is treated like the home it is. My Guests are responsible for replacing and/or refunding any missing or damaged items. We want you to have a relaxing and amazing time during your stay in San Diego!
host_about:
I love traveling, exploring and have been lucky enough to travel all around the world. However, no matter where I've visited, it is always wonderful to be in San Diego, its a beautiful place to live or visit. 
It has so much to offer, and I love that I am able to share my Southern California home with others.

neighborhood_overview: San Diego is known for its year-round sunny skies, pleasant temperatures, and beautiful beaches. And now, right in the middle of it all, WorldMark San Diego - Mission Valley is ready to host you in one of the greatest cities in California.  Your new resort—located in the quiet San Diego suburb of Mission Valley—consists of 167 one- and two-bedroom units, each with a fully equipped kitchen. Resort amenities include a pool, spa, exercise facility, and free underground parking. You may want to block off some time for Balboa Park—only 4.5 miles from the resort. The park is akin to San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park or New York City’s Central Park and is, in fact, the nation’s largest urban cultural park, coming in at 1,174 acres. space: This lovely 1921 Craftsman home offers old-fashioned comfort with modern amenities.  The spacious house boasts 1500 sq. ft. with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms.  Private tranquil gardens surround the home, which is in a quiet, cul-de-sac neighborhood.  The master bedroom suite has attached, updated bathroom with shower, tub and bidet.   Brand new king bed with private garden view.   Guest bedroom features queen bed and cozy reading chair.  Full bath with tub and shower across hall.  Both bedrooms have curtains but not blackout.  Central heating and air conditioning keep  temperatures comfortable.  Roomy kitchen offers dishwasher,  wall oven, old-fashioned gas range/stove, side-by-side fridge/freezer.
