neighborhood_overview: Mission Hills in one of the oldest and most charming neighborhoods in San Diego.  Within walking distance there are many great restaurants, shops, summer Cinema Under the Stars, Pioneer Park and tennis courts.   It is within minutes of some of San Diego's finest attractions, including San Diego Zoo, Sea World, Old Town, Gas Lamp, Embarcadero, Coronado and many of our fine beaches.
notes: The gardeners come  weekly on Thursdays.  You do not need to be at home.  They tend front, side and back gardens. Trash bins are in the back patio.  If they are more than 1/2 full, please place them at the edge of the driveway Tuesday night or early Wednesday morning and bring them back in Wednesday afternoon.  Please refer to the recycle schedule in the house manual. This is a residential neighborhood but near all the hustle and bustle of our busy town.  That convenience comes with some typical high-density in-town noise.  You may hear train whistles, street noise, planes, dogs and other sounds.  The neighbors to the north have a shelter dog that barks.  For him I use a Dome (white noise machine) which is next to each bed.  Two volumes.   I find it works well. From here, it's a 10 minute drive to downtown and Comic-Con.  Or, even better, a short bus ride and no parking problems!
transit: You are 2 blocks from the city bus, 10 minute drive from the airport, train station, trolley, and Comic-Con.  10 blocks walk to city DecoBike rent-a-bike station.   Garage is not offered but there is ample street parking.
access: Entire space is available except for locked owner's closets and garage.  Ample street parking is available.
interaction: I will be in contact with you before your arrival and as much as you need during your stay and will provide the lock box combination for house keys.
house_rules: Subletting this rental is not permitted.  Originating guest is responsible for seeing that all guests leave at the end of the rental term. House sleeps 4.  Approval and additional charges for additional guests, to be discussed.   Any changes in the original number of guests at time of reservation, must also be approved by owner. Minimum age limit for renters and guests is 21. No rearranging of household furnishings or their removal from property is permitted. Non-smoking only.    Pets not allowed.     Check-in time: 4PM.  Check-out time: 11AM Neighborhood setting.  Please be considerate of noise volume after 10PM and before 7AM. Minimum stay is 3 nights.  Maximum stay is 28 nights, unless otherwise arranged with owner. If your stay is long-term, additional cleanings will be scheduled at guest's expense. Please prefer ya
interaction: We will be here for Check-in, check-out and anytime in between that you have any questions! Please check out all of our reviews to see how much our previous guests have liked staying with us. We have All 5 star reviews! We take pride in doing our best to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We are on call for your 24/7 for any needs you may have throughout your stay.  You'll have both of our numbers so you can reach us anytime with questions or needs.  We look forward to making your stay as enjoyable as all of our previous guests!
house_rules: No parties, please, this is a shared property and a nice, quiet family neighborhood.  No smoking.  No drugs.  No unpaid guests overnight. Please book for the amount of people you bring.  Please empty the kitchen & bathroom trash cans and clean dishes before check out.  Please prefer back yard use to main house guests when they are already using for their privacy, but help yourself to the BBQ area and jacuzzi on a first come basis. For the jacuzzi you will need to push the plus (+) button to raise the temperature to the desired temperature (usually we use it at 101 or 102 degrees F)  Please lower the temperature back down to 98 when finished. Please close and lock the cover when finished, please no eating or drinking in the Jacuzzi. :)
host_about:
Hi! 
I'm Rachel, I love the beach and playing sports.  I'm a great cook, love to read and watch movies.  I'm easy going, relaxed and friendly and I'm looking forward to having you stay here in one of our beautiful homes in America's Finest City!  We enjoy hosting long term and short term stays and have several different size homes located throughout the county. We are sure to have something available that suits your needs.  We are glad to have you stay and do our best to make you comfortable, and are on call for anything you need during your trip!

My husband says I should open a restaurant to showcase all of his favorites of my cooking. If you stay in our home You may get a chance to sample something while you're here from his list of favorites like Vietnamese Pho Noodle Soup, our Real Italian family recipe Lasanha (Brazilian Portuguese spelling! This Italian Family recipe was passed onto our Brazilian grandmother by her Italian Mother-In-Law) or my own Creme Brûlée recipe!  All home made from scratch :)

Favorite travel destination: Fernando de Noronha, Brasil

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

access: The space has independent access from the right side of the main house, using the metal green door and it is located at the very end of the backyard. interaction: The backyard is in common so we may meet out there :)  NOTICE : THE ENTRANCE OF THE HOUSE IN ON THE MAIN STREET. SOMETIME (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) MAP OR OTHER MAP APP ESPECIALLY RUNNING ON IPHONE COULD BRING YOU IN THE ALLEY ( WRONG PLACE)
house_rules: - We are clean, professional and respectful people and we like quiet and clean guests.  - Pets are not allowed. - No smoke in the house. You can smoke in the back yard patio. - No Jacuzzi after 9 pm to not disturb the neighbor - You shall keep your food and your drink in the fridge present in your room. - You can control the garden lights using the outside white switch located on the side of the house little after the green door. Other then that enjoy San Diego :)

I am a really easy going and nice guy also I love to travel and meet people from all around the world.
I hope to have the pleasure to meet you in my house. Ciao!

name: Awesome Pet-Friendly Beach Cottage!
summary: Cozy, renovated 1 BD/1 BA house with parking & patio, 1 block from the beach and a quick walk from restaurants & bars. We've paid attention to the details so you'll feel at home!! Unbeatable location & charm!! 99 - 249/night depending on season.
space: From the moment you walk through the front gate, you know this place is something special -  Waypoint Cottage has been welcoming vacationers to OB for more than 100 years and the vibes of good times and lazy strolls to the beach are strong here.  While the inside has been completely gut renovated, the outside still has that simple early 20th century beach look - you half expect to see an old woolen bathing suit drying on the rustic adirondack chairs out front! While the shops & restaurants may have changed, daily life at Waypoint Cottage is still very similar to how it was years ago. Wake up in the morning to the sound of kids playing (hard for them to sleep late with the excitement of the area.) Walk along the water to Newbreak Cafe for your morning cuppa Joe - or, if you're traveling with canine companions, make the short walk to dog beach for some fun morning frolicking. There's plenty of time to get back and make a homemade breakfast - maybe you've had a chance to swing by the week

neighborhood_overview: Ocean Beach is San Diego's most authentic Cali Beach neighborhood.  It is laid back and has fewer vacation rentals than Mission Beach or Pacific Beach, so staying in Ocean Beach is a much more residential experience. The population is a mix of young people and middle-aged folks. It was a big hippie neighborhood in the 1960s and 1970s and that vibe still exists today. The cottage is located a bit away from the party, but there is still a 'beach party' atmosphere around the place - during the day you may hear kids playing or people listening to music and grilling out in their backyards. At night on the weekends, you may hear a party in the evening (though most don't extend too far into the night.) The beach neighborhoods are on the flight path from San Diego airport, so there is some airplane noise during the daytime, but there is a curfew so no flights from 11:30 PM until 6:30 AM, and most guests don't notice the noise after arrival.
notes: This property is air conditioned with a room air conditioner.  The air conditioner is usually in place July through October, but we will of course put it in temporarily in case of an unexpected heat wave! (The average high temperature in the hottest season is 76 degrees, so the AC doesn't get much use!!) The beach neighborhoods are on the flight path from San Diego airport, so there is some airplane noise during the daytime, but there is a curfew so no flights from 11:30 PM until 6:30 AM, and most guests don't notice the noise after arrival.
transit: There are two commercial areas within walking distance of the property - Newport Ave and North OB.  Both have bars, restaurants, and shops.  (When you check in we will provide you with a guide to the area's highlights!) Beyond that, it is advisable to have a car, public transportation in San Diego is not great and bike lanes are inconsistent.  There are a couple bus lines a block away.  There is a trolley line and train line close by in Old Town (bus takes you there and downtown), from which you can access malls, the stadium, downtown, and other locations.
access: This cottage is a vacation rental located in a private, gated 4-unit cottage complex.  Our unit is the only one that is in continuous use as a vacation rental - two others are occasionally rented out, and the remaining one is a 2nd home that is rarely used by the owner. You will have an assigned off-street parking space and will also have an exclusive use front patio area with grill, and a private side yard. We have toiletries and can provide basic pantry items if desired (coffee, cream, etc.)
interaction: We are happy to have any level of interaction that you prefer! This is a private beach cottage not attached to any main house, and we don't live on the property. Some guests just want to access the property on a lockbox; others want to meet us and get recommendations on things to do.
house_rules: Please note that third party reservations are not allowed by AirBNB. Please do not attempt to make a booking for a friend or relative; if we discover it prior to check-in, your reservation will be cancelled. If someone other than the registered guest shows up at check-in, they will not be allowed to stay at the property.  This is a quiet residential area, there are no parties, events or gatherings allowed. We respect the wonderful neighbors that we share the block with, so unfortunately if you violate this rule it *will* result in the cancellation of the remainder of your stay and your removal from the property. We hate to be harsh about this (we really are very mellow hosts despite what it might seem in this section) but we really value & prioritize hosting to people who will respect the neighborhood!! Finally, please read the listing carefully and look at all the photos - and ask questions if you have any. We're not able to offer a refund after check-in simply because a guest failed
host_about:
We are a husband and wife team who have been put in charge of renting out our family's lovingly furnished, fully equipped beach houses when they're not in use! We love meeting new people and helping visitor's figure out how to make the most of their time in this great city. We are pretty laid back and accommodating as hosts. We're relatively new to AirBNB, but not new to the business of running vacation rentals. 

We spend most of our time being foodies and enjoying the California lifestyle (sunshine, hot-tubbing, taking our pups to dog beach, and sipping locally brewed beers and Temecula wines.)  When we're not in San Diego, you can usually find us somewhere else pleasant and sunny - Puerto Rico, Italy, Greece, Bermuda, and Hawaii are some of our favorite haunts.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 2,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

Established in 2002, SeaBreeze truly epitomizes what it means to cater to not only vacationers, but to the property owners. A commitment to providing a once in a lifetime experience for guests, and a trusting and professional relationship with property owners is our top priority.

neighborhood_overview: From the San Diego Visitor`s Bureau - While some may compare San Diego’s Mission Beach to the East Coast’s Atlantic City and Coney Island, there is a unique Southern California vibe you can’t find anywhere else here. Nestled between Pacific Beach on the north side, and Belmont Park on its southern side, Mission Beach offers a lively and robust variety of activities in the sun, surf and sand. From hot dog stands to fine dining eateries, hot night clubs to street performers, expect to find all kinds of free-spirited beach goers in a fun, carnival-like atmosphere along the sandy shores.
notes: Amenities: Kitchen: Electric Stove/Oven Range, Microwave, Refrigerator, Dishwasher, Service for 8 Living Room: Extended Cable, Wi-Fi Master Bedroom: King Size Bed, Private Bath Second Bedroom: Queen Size Bed, Balcony, Semi-Private Bath Third Bedroom: Full Size Bed, Twin Size Bed, Half Bath, Ground Floor Patio Laundry: Private Stacked Laundry Beach Access: 2 Houses From Ocean Front and Boardwalk BBQ: Natural Gas BBQ and Electric BBQ Parking: 2-Car Tandem Garage WiFi: YES A/C: Central Air with Zoned Temperature Control Extras: Beach Chairs, Beach Towels, 2 Junior Futons
transit: Public transportation is not abundant or super convenient in the beach areas.
access: Just two houses from the ocean front. Outdoor shower, private ground floor patio with gas BBQ, private balcony off the living/dining areas with seating for 8 and electric BBQ, and private balcony off Bedroom Two.

ACCESSIBILITY – Access to your unit is either by keyless entry or keys in a lockbox on the Premises. The keyless entry code or lock box code and directions for use will be provided in your welcome package approximately two weeks prior to occupancy. All keys and remotes (if applicable) are to be left in the unit and one set returned to the lock box at the end of your visit. A 150 fee may apply for each key or remote not left in unit and/or lockbox. SUPPLIES – The Premises is equipped with linens, towels, dishes, cooking utensils, and all furnishings based upon normal occupancy and use. The Premises is also equipped with a starter su
host_about:
My name is Denise and I handle all of our reservations and guest communications at Pacific Sunset Group (PSG). I'm who you'll speak with on the phone or communicate with via text/email. I love to laugh (and embarrassingly do so in totally inappropriate situations), make stupid jokes, eat chips and salsa, listen to jazz, escape into a good book, and hang out with my husband, Brent, and my three dogs: Bella, Trixie, and Mikey. You'll never find me without dog hair on my clothes, I've learned not to fight it any longer. My favorite quote is by Jack Kerouac "Be in love with your life - every minute of it".

I've got 15+ years experience in residential and commercial real estate management (which makes me sound really old) an MA in Literature and Writing Studies; I've been licensed as a Realtor® for almost 20 years and as a Real Estate Broker for over 10 years. And, because I like to always be learning, also hold the designations of GRI® (Graduate Real Estate Institute), RMS® (Risk Management Specialist), and ePro® (Real Estate Technology Specialist). 

PSG is family owned and operated.  We believe in treating every home we manage with a personal touch, as if it's our own, and treating every guest who stays with us as a welcome friend. I can safely say that making our guests happy is the most important thing we do. 

We started in 1999 as a management company for own own real estate holdings and have been growing (or trying to!) ever since. As far as all the professional stuff is concerned - we hold memberships with the National Association of Realtors®, California Association of Realtors®, San Diego Association of Realtors®, Vacation Rental Managers Association, San Diego Vacation Rental Managers Alliance, and the Better Business Bureau. All our staff are licensed Realtors® and both Denise and JJ are licensed Real Estate Brokers.

access: Private gated separate entrance private studio on shared property with our 4 bedroom house, in a quiet, residential neighborhood with plenty of free street parking. Studio has front door with Keyless entry, remote control ceiling fan & light, 60" flat screen TV with 300+ channel satelite service, wall mounted gas fireplace with remote control thermostat / heater, Kitchen, bath, Wi-Fi.  Clean Towels, bedding, hand soap, kitchen sponge, paper towels, dish soap, toilet paper, shampoo and conditioner are provided for each guest.  Shared fenced backyard with grassy area, roses, Jacuzzi, BBQ on the stamped concrete patio area with table and chairs, many fruit bearing trees (avocado, peach, lime, lemon, orange) and lush garden including passionfruit, blueberries, raspberries, blackberries, boysenberries, strawberries, and raised bed veggie garden.  One Free entrance to the world famous San Diego Zoo upon request and bikes available to borrow.
interaction: We will be here for Check in, checkout and anytime in between that you have any questions! Please check out all of our positive reviews to see how much our previous guests have liked staying with us. We have all 5 star reviews!  We take pride in doing our best to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We are on call for your 24/7 for any needs you may have throughout your stay.  You'll have both of our numbers so you can reach us anytime with questions or needs.  We look forward to making your stay as enjoyable as all of our previous guests!
house_rules: No parties, this is a shared property and a nice, quiet family neighborhood.  No smoking on property, feel free to smoke outside the gate, please clean up your butts. Don't smoke on front swing, it has damaged our last swing and had to buy a new one.  No drugs.  Please empty the kitchen & bathroom trash cans, wash and put away dishes and clean any mess before check out.  Please help yourself to the jacuzzi, you will need to push the plus (+) button to raise the temperature to the desired temperature and allow a few hours for it to heat up(usually we use it at 101 or 102 degrees F)  Please lower the temperature back down to 98 when finished. Please close and lock the cover when finished, please no eating or drinking in the Jacuzzi. Please no one under 16 allowed in Jacuzzi.  No Jumping or Diving. No standing or sitting on cover. Use at your own risk.
host_about:
Hi! 
I'm Rachel, I love the beach and playing sports.  I'm a great cook, love to read and watch movies.  I'm easy going, relaxed and friendly and I'm looking forward to having you stay here in one of our beautiful homes in America's Finest City!  We enjoy hosting long term and short term stays and have several different size homes located throughout the county. We are sure to have something available that suits your needs.  We are glad to have you stay and do our best to make you comfortable, and are on call for anything you need during your trip!

My husband says I should open a restaurant to showcase all of his favorites of my cooking. If you stay in our home You may get a chance to sample something while you're here from his list of favorites like Vietnamese Pho Noodle Soup, our Real Italian family recipe Lasanha (Brazilian Portuguese spelling! This Italian Family recipe was passed onto our Brazilian grandmother by her Italian Mother-In-Law) or my own Creme Brûlée recipe!  All home made from scratch :)

Favorite travel destination: Fernando de Noronha, Brasil

house_rules: Resort Parking Parking is limited at WorldMark San Diego - Mission Valley and the resort is unable to accommodate the storage of boats, RVs and trailers. There is a vehicle height limit of 6’ 10”. Your room key will be needed to open the garage gate. Please obtain a parking permit for all vehicles from the Front Desk. Pool & Hot Tub Information Children in diapers must wear waterproof diapers designed for swimming. There are no lifeguards on duty. Please refer to posted pool signage for more specific information. This year round pool is open from 8 a.m. – 10 p.m. with the first and last hour reserved for adult swim.
host_about:
I rent out my WorldMark timeshare -- 120+ resort locations all over the US, Mexico, Canada, Australia, Fiji, New Zealand, and England.

My specialty is last-minute short-stay accommodations, but please be smart about your expectations: if it's less than a month before any kind of holiday, concert, or event, it's likely already booked up. Accommodations in Indio and Palms Springs sell out within an HOUR of Coachella tickets going on sale* but it's the same two weekends every year, so be smart about it. Holidays and summer weekends also book up far in advance. 

You can book as far as 13 months out.

*If you book more than 10 months out, there is a 7-night minimum.

If you want to book a Friday or a Saturday, there is a three-night minimum -- unless you are booking within 48 hours of check-in (4pm)

I have units that can accommodate as many as eight people. Have more than eight? You can rent more that one unit! The Maximum Occupancy listed on the listing is as true as gravity and cannot be altered with because the Fire Marshal said so. Respect the Fire Marshal's wisdom.

Almost all units have a complete kitchen. In addition to full-size appliances, you'll find plates, glasses, silverware, and other kitchen items. All linens, including towels, are included. You have access to all resort amenities -- that means the pool, the hot tub, the gym, free parking, etc.

Sadly, the resorts do not allow pets.

Wifi is 4.95/day or 15.95/stay. This is 100% a resort fee that I have 0% control over.

This is a timeshare. Someone at the resort might (but probably won't) try to talk you into buying a timeshare. They'll even give you a present if you say yes! Saying yes means dealing with them for the next two hours, and that's *not* why you went on vacation. BE SMART - SAY NO - GO ENJOY YOUR VACATION! :)

We've had too many bad experiences with guests from Orange County, California. If you are a current or former resident of Orange County and would like to rent from us, kindly be kind in your messages; we'll get the hint that you're a decent person and will welcome you with open arms.

***Feel good about your vacation! A portion of every rental fee goes to help purchase clothing, shoes, school supplies, medical supplies, and nutritious food for children through Children International. Learn more about Children International and consider sponsoring a child yourself!***

name: Charmed by the Sea (403)
summary: The smell of fresh ocean air, the sounds of ocean waves, and the sights of picturesque sunsets all combine to make "Charmed by the Sea" the ideal condo for your next vacation.
space: Ideally located so guests have the best of La Jolla at their fingertips, "Charmed by the Sea" sits across the street from La Jolla's most stunning beach and is a short 5 minute walk to the Village. Literally just steps away from the sand and surf, this tastefully remodeled two bedroom two bath condo is beautifully appointed and offers guests both recreation and relaxation. The spacious living room offers breathtaking northerly views of the ocean, beach, and shoreline. Professionally decorated to provide maximum comfort and enjoyment, the living room is complete with comfortable seating for four guests as well as a 52" flat screen TV. This wonderful condo is further complimented by two bedrooms, the master with a king sized bed with a 37" flat screen TV and private bathroom and the second bedroom with a queen bed and 32" flat screen TV. Complete with a well equipped kitchen, WIFI, and garage parking, "Charmed by the Sea" has everything you need to insure your complete enjoyment. THINGS

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 3,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

name: Guest House/Great location!
summary: The guest house is 500 square feet and has a separate entrance.  1 bedroom/kitchen/shower/tub. Pool and barbecue grill. Separate from main house.  Parking in front on street.
space: The guest house is fully furnished.  It's located in Point Loma/Ocean Beach and is perfect for a San Diego vacation experience.  The living room has both a sofa and a love seat.  A 32" flat screen TV is located in the living room.  The kitchen is fully equipped and has a microwave, cook top and refrigerator.  There is a breakfast bar with seating.  The bedroom includes walk in closet, and king size bed.  The guest house has plenty of bath and beach towels.  WIFi and cable included.  A patio table, and barbecue grill are poolside.  The guest house is equipped with 2 ceiling fans.  The average temperature is 75, with night time temperatures in the 60's.  The San Diego zoo, Point Loma, Ocean Beach, Mission Beach, La Jolla and downtown are minutes away.  If you need anything during your stay we are here to assist you.

The De-Wills gourmet kitchen & appliances will inspire the budding chef in you while being able to look out over the enclosed back yard, water fountain & covered patio (with TV, grill, prep station etc.) - perfect for out-door living.  Re-modeled 3 years ago it has AC & heat, a gas fire place, Ping-Pong table, kayak and surfboard. This is a four bed, 3 bath detached home. It has two front entrances and three from the back yard, via a gated (electronic) driveway to one side. Parking out front is usually available for two cars. I, or a representative of mine shall provide access upon arrival between 4 - 8pm (preferred), but other arrangements can be made outside these hours if necessary. There is one entrance with electronic access (requires iPhone), but hopefully I will be there to greet you. I will generally let guests ha
neighborhood_overview: Bay Park covers an escarpment over looking Mission Bay to the West and gets the sea breezes that come off the Pacific Ocean, generally keeping the temperatures down. It is not a cookie-cutter neighborhood so every home is different. Residents get to watch the nightly Sea World fire work display which is located on the far side of the bay. The local grocery store (Keils) and restaurants are easily walkable being 10 mins from the house.
notes: This is a typical family oriented neighborhood, all respectful of each other & their privacy, but will stop & talk to you if you look lost or your dog has run off! The trash pickup is usually on a Wednesday morning & most residents put their cans out the night before, so be careful if driving off early somewhere! General trash (black) cans go out every week, with the recycling and garden waste alternating week to week.
transit: The home is just off the I-5 from the Claremont exist, that makes it easy to get north to LA or south to Mexico, while I-8 will take you east, just one exit south from here. Mission Bay and the ocean is just 2 mins away, the airport is 10mins in one direction, Pacific Beach 10 mins in the other, while La Jolla is 15mins. The local bus (No.105) has stops one street away (4 min walk) and will take you to Old Town (Mexican village) and beyond.
access: I, or a representative of mine shall provide access upon arrival between 4 - 8pm (preferred), but other arrangements can be made outside these hours if necessary. There is one entrance with electronic access (requires iPhone), but hopefully I will be there to greet you.
interaction: I will generally let guests have their privacy, but if there are questions I can be reached by txt, email or phone.
host_about: I'm from the UK originally & been in the US now for 16 years - the last 6 here in San Diego. I've travelled most places in the world, met some interesting people. I still love a good English pint and a curry with friends is a great way to catch up. I like relatively simple things - they tend to work better and last longer! A good wine & cheese usually leads to good conversations. I like to be as self-sufficient (as one can be), & I'd rather save for something of quality than buy something cheap that gets thrown out after 6 months.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

name: Modern Pacific Beach Flat
summary: This recently-renovated one-bedroom condo is a short walk to the beautiful beaches, food and nightlife of downtown Pacific Beach. Perfect for a couple wanting a quiet haven to relax in comfort after days of surfing, sunbathing, shopping and dining. 20 minutes to downtown.
space: If you're looking for comfort and modern amenities in a a great location then this is the place for you! Sleep comfortably on the queen-sized Temperpedic memory foam mattress--you'll be amazed how deeply you'll sleep!  When you're not eating out in the great neighborhood restaurants, cook in our Fully-equipped kitchen, with efficient and eco-friendly induction stovetop, dishwasher,  and convection oven. We recommend produce from the Saturday La Jolla Farmers Market! Relax on the sofa after a long day and watch a movie on the giant flat-screen TV with surround sound. It's hooked up to Apple TV, Netflix, Amazon, Hulu Plus, and HBO Now. Wifi internet is included.  Enjoy the ocean breezes on the balcony.

neighborhood_overview: Perfect location in a quiet neighborhood near the heart of Pacific Beach just 3 blocks from the ocean and 2 blocks from the hip restaurants and cafes on Cass St. It's a great launching point for surfing, sunbathing, dining and shopping in PB but quiet enough to feel like a retreat. Within 4 blocks from home you can: • Do sunrise yoga overlooking the ocean in Palisades Park  • Eat amazing tacos at Oscar's • Get a fantastic morning coffee or smoothie...or enjoy an evening cocktail in the cafes on Cass St.  • Surf, swim, stroll or sunbathe at the beach
transit: You could stay in Pacific Beach and enjoy all the great beaches, restaurants and shopping in walking distance from our flat (which is quite a lot!). Local bike rentals are a popular way to explore Pacific Beach! There is a bus stop on our block that connects to the city's public transportation system.  To explore San Diego's other neighborhoods and attractions a car is recommended but not required.  Adjacent neighborhoods and attractions include: • Elegant shopping, dining, art museums, and seal and sea lion viewing in La Jolla • Cute coffee shops and lunch spots in hidden gem Bird Rock neighborhood • Unparalleled sunset hiking in Sunset Cliffs and Torrey Pines parks • Bohemian beach-side shops in Mission Beach (a lovely 1-hour beach stroll from our flat)
access: Coin operated washer and dryer in building.  Wifi and television with AppleTV, Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Prime, and HBO Now.  Beach supplies including boogie boards, beach mats, beach towels, and games.  Nearby bike and surfboard rental.
interaction: We'll make arrangements by phone and the flat will be ready for you when you arrive. You'll have it all to yourselves, but can reach us by email or text if issues arise. The doors have key-code electric locks that we control remotely, so you never have to worry about losing your key or getting locked out!
house_rules: No smoking, please. This is a residential building with families so we ask that you keep noise to a minimum late at night.

The park is akin to San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park or New York City’s Central Park and is, in fact, the nation’s largest urban cultural park, coming in at 1,174 acres. With eight gardens, 15 museums, nine restaurants and cafes, a golf course, the San Diego Zoo, a puppet theater, golf course, and the world’s largest outdoor organ (and this isn’t even a close to a complete list), you could do something different in Balboa Park every day for the next two months. Water lovers will also find endless possibilities. Cruise the bay on a boat excursion. Hang ten at Pacific Beach. Watch for whales at the Cabrillo National Monument. Scuba dive or snorkel off La Jolla Cove, where you’ll find an aquatic ecological reserve just waiting to be explored. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

summary: Resort-like amenities, close proximity to beaches and city. Quiet, predominately owner-occupied condo complex. Minutes away from Mission Beach, walk-able to Fashion Valley Mall and Green Line Trolley stops at either Fashion Valley Mall or Linda Vista, close to UofSD. Downtown is less than 15 minutes trolley or driving. Airport is 12 minutes drive. Secure underground parking and 24 hour security. Outdoor gas grills and 2 pools. I live here and share it with friends when I go to LA for work.
space: This location is perfect for access to all of what San Diego offers. I am within a few miles from Mission Bay. Close to Fashion Valley Mall, downtown and Balboa Park. It's sunny and bright with nice evening temperatures being close to the beaches. Minimal decor for an uncluttered open comfortable feel. The patio is a large part of the open living area. The large sliding door allows the perfect temperatures of San Diego in. I do have central air and heat for those unusual off days. I can hear the SeaWorld fireworks from here and view them from the deck on the 1st floor. My second floor unit overlooks a BBQ area and garden stream. I have hummingbirds and sparrows in the mature trees. The entire complex is like a garden of Eden. I have a natural latex  mattress and pillow top down alternative mattress cover and duvet. I have high thread-count cotton sheets. My bed is hotel quality for ultimate sleep comfort.

interaction: There is a lock box at the back gate allowing you to drive in the guest parking.

host_about: Hello, we are a fun loving, artsy, and out going couple who love exploring new cities, going on adventures, and meeting awesome people along our journeys!! Alicia works as an Occupational therapist in the schools helping students with special needs to be independent problem solvers. Daria is a photographer who enjoys creating concept photos and professionally building up small businesses. We typically choose to stay with other AirBnB hosts when traveling, so we are especially conscious of the needs of travelers.

summary: Simple 1 bedroom apartment. On an alley (there is city noise= trucks, buses & cars/city type living) Ideal for 2, but the 3rd can sleep on couch :).  Kept super clean but not fancy, PRICED ACCORDINGLY.  Street parking. Wifi signal weak but works.
space: I am fully honest with your stay here!  Just so you can make the best choice for your needs.   Here's the details= The apartment is on an alley behind our house, so there is some city noise, like cars, motorcycles, buses and dogs.   Wednesday morning is trash day, that's the only time it will be a little more noisy than normal, just for 5 minutes or so.    You can expect it to be clean when you walk in.  I disinfect everything upon checkout.    We have a bunny farm right below the apartment deck.  Feel free to say hi to them.  You can use the deck and BBQ. neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood.  Right besides us in the sage green house with the rooftop deck is a lawyer and professor.  They are so sweet.  On 14th and Market you will find a really great Albertson's grocery store.  Crossing over to 25th and B St you will find the famous Luigi's Pizza and a swanky bar called The Turf Sipper Club.  And of course 1 mile away is the Gaslamp and East Village, a very fun area for food and drinks and shopping !  Be sure to also go to the top of Grant Hill Park, J St and 26th St.  The view of the bridge is amazing !!!!!  We love our neighborhood, we are so happy to live here in Sherman Heights.
notes: I had one comment that the futon is firm.  So just FYI if you have 3 people and 1 has to sleep there.  I like firm for my back but I just wanted to pass on the feedback.  The person can sleep on it the way it is or put it in bed position.    To make it into the bed, you have to pull it out from the wall a little bit.  Then pull it up together in a V shape and lay it back down.  Sometimes when you set it back to couch mode it doesn't catch right.  If that happens just push it against the wall and it will stay up and not fall down to bed position.   The sheets for the futon are on the shelf in the closet.  They will always be clean.   The queen bed in the bedroom is super comfy and soft.
transit: There is a bus stop right across the street and the trolley is about 5 blocks down on Commercial and 25th St.  We also have bikes for rent, that is our favorite mode of transportation.
access: I will give you a lock box code so you can come anytime after 2pm and let yourselves in.  You can enter from the alley in the back or the front house (# 2481 address).  We have our bike workshop below the apartment but we are super quiet and limit noise before 8am.  Some guests hardly notice we are there fixing bikes and loading them in  the truck.
interaction: We give you lots of privacy.  No need to check in with us, but if you want to we are friendly !    Or if you need a linen change or new towels, you can message me or come to the front house to let us know.
house_rules: Have fun !

neighborhood_overview: Ocean Beach is a quaint little Southern California beach community that has a lot of character. Ocean Beach (OB) is centrally located and therefore close to everything you might want to see including, the Beach, Downtown, Gas Lamp, Mission Bay, Sea World, Balboa Park/SD Zoo and Old Town. The great thing about San Diego is how moderate the temperature is year around along with all the sunny days we get. This makes commuting by bike much more enjoyable. There is a paved bike trail that can get you to many of the destinations I listed above in less than 30 minutes. OBs main drag is Newport Avenue which boasts a ton of great restaurants, tattoo parlors, breweries, shops and Bars. The longest concrete pier on the West Coast is our OB Pier which is great for fishing, sunsets, and watching surfers. If you follow the shoreline south from the pier you will discover Sunset Cliffs which is a beautiful stretch of coast that sits above the Pacific Ocean  containing a net work of trails and beautifu
transit: I provide my guests with 2 bikes and a lock. Car 2 San Diego Bus MTS San Diego Train SD Trolley and Coaster train  DecoBike San Diego Lyft Car Share App   Bike Share Program  Ocean Beach Bike Path, Mission Bay Bike Path

That being said I have a lot of experience hiking, biking, surfing, and climbing all over Southern CA and am more than willing to share with my guests some adventures off the beaten trail. If guests wish to have little to no interaction with me and want privacy that is not a problem.
house_rules: We are very laid back but do have a few ground rules that we ask our guests adhere to. All cigarette smoking must be done away from the condo by the street where it will not bother any of my neighbors who do not smoke. Please take your shoes off when you Come in the front door. We also ask that you be courteous to our neighbors by keeping the noise down while you are staying at our home. No added guests that were not included in your reservation payment. Please respect our space as you would your own.

neighborhood_overview: Quinn Cottage is found on perhaps the most exclusive cul de sac street in the historic and affluent neighborhood of Mission Hills.  The cottage is within walking distance to farmers' markets, coffee houses, restaurants, shops, parks, and the famous Old Town area of San Diego.  Everyone walks in this friendly family neighborhood, so rental guests will find happy, chatty locals in the many locations.  During the summer the neighborhood park has free picnic concerts for everyone's enjoyment.
notes: Weather in Mission Hills, heavily influenced by its coastal location, is close to perfect in all seasons.  Fresh marine air and breezes keep the winter warmer and the summer cooler than temperatures in locations even slightly more inland.  Sleeping with windows open, eating on the deck, and garden barbeques can be enjoyed most days in all seasons.  September is the warmest month with short seasonal bursts of higher temperatures.  Another special amenity -- guests will find  the cottage as well-stocked as any family home with lovely dishes, glass and bar ware, table ware, cooking appliances, cookware, bake ware, and a pantry stocked with herbs, spices, oils, sugar, flour, coffee, tea, and much more.  It even has a completely outfitted first aid kit. In addition to the rent stated guests will be charged the 11% City of San Diego Vacation Rental Tax.  Special weekly rates are also offered.
transit: Quinn Cottage is in a perfect location just above Old Town and Presidio Park.  It is only five to ten minutes from the airport, Little Italy, Downtown Gaslamp District, the famous San Diego Zoo, Sea World, Balboa Park, Petco Park, the harbor, Mission Valley Shopping Centers, golf courses, and many beaches.  A bus stop is one block from the cottage and a large trolley transit center is within walking distance in Old Town.  The trolley lines go to many locations, including the San Diego Convention Center.  The cottage is also just a few minutes from freeways 5 and 8 for quick jaunts to La Jolla, Del Mar racetrack, Torrey Pines Golf Course, LEGOLAND, Safari Park, as well as other coastal and mountain locations.  The cottage has its own private off-street parking in a large driveway just at the cottage entrance.
access: Quinn Cottage is surrounded by lush gardens and several private patios for dining and relaxing.  One lovely patio right off the cottage kitchen has a gas barbeque and dining table with colorful umbrella.  The hot tub deck has stunning views and another dining table with umbrella. The breathtaking cottage gardens include a large, year-round organic vegetable garden and seasonal flowers, all shared with rental guests . The gardens enchant visitors with numerous "rooms" to explore with whimsical pieces of "exterior art" as well as many places to sit to savor its natural beauty.  Parking is especially fabulous at the cottage.  A large off-street driveway allows for renters' private parking right at the cottage entrance.  A full laundry room inside the cottage has complete laundry and cleaning supplies, including a European drying rack.. The cottage is fully outfitted with beautiful linens, towels, body washes, shampoo, lotion, and paper products.  A storage area holds a full array of beach
interaction: Jeff and Mary Quinn pride themselves in their hospitality, respect for guests' privacy, and the pristine condition of the charming cottage.  They are always happy to help guests with tourist decisions and plans, while otherwise rarely encountering rental guests during their stay.  The Quinn's are always reachable by phone even if they are in a location other than San Diego.  A handyman is just a phone call away for any need.
house_rules: The cottage itself has always been pet-free and smoking-free.  There are nice outdoor locations for smoking away from doorways and complete with ashtrays.   Cottage rental guests are expected to follow reasonable quiet hours and respectful behavior in this lovely family neighborhood.  No social functions are allowed at the cottage without express agreements between the cottage owners and rental guests.  Rental guests are given a very useful policies and house use guide at reservation and check-in that helps create an easy and memorable stay.
host_about:
We are life-long residents of San Diego. Thirty-five years ago we started vacationing on Orcas Island.  Eventually, we bought a second home on Orcas and now we are part time residents in San Diego and Orcas.    In SD we have been active in the business, entertainment, and museum communities.  On Orcas we have become members of a vibrant community of artists, environmentalists, musicians, and a host of island characters.  On the island we boat, kayak, pick berries and bake pies, cook, and entertain or friends, our kids, and our grand kids.   
We love our San Diego home and we take great satisfaction in sharing it with others.  We have lots of good advice about how to create a truly unique visitor experience in our home base city.  We are passionate gardeners, creating beautiful and delightful surroundings for our rental guests.  Our pride in our lovely properties is obvious, so come and see it for yourself.  We know you will love what you find
And there is no greater joy than sharing Orcas Island with others.  Our house is a lovely waterfront home.  Everything about Orcas is magic, and our living room with expansive views and our large deck is the perfect place to settle into the wonders of island life.
 We feel fortunate to being able to share both San Diego and Orcas Island with vacationers through Air BNB.  
We invite you to visit and experience the magic yourself.  Be prepared to fall in love with both of our homes just as so many rental guests have done.

interaction: We are social and friendly. We love to share beer when we have some, and occasionally some wine. Though we are fine doing our own thing if you want to do yours.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

access: Come and go any hour you want.  The neighborhood is safe and quiet. I also have a new drinking water system so can have all the drinking water u want. Better than bottled water.
interaction: Also I run a antique car chauffeuring company so know the whole city & county very well and can help with your travel. I also have sightseeing available very reasonable and fun for you with photos.
house_rules: I am sorry but I do not offer any long term rentals, ( sometimes a week is OK) as my daughter comes over from AZ and use's my spare bedroom.  I also provide a free ride in one of my 5 antique cars I gave here just check hireoldcars out. Fun fun fun Lance
host_about: 78 year old self employed antique car chauffeuring company mostly weddings father of 2 children from my first wife and 2 adopted children from my 2nd wife and 8 grandchildren, now single living alone, and enjoying my fun wedding business, and I am a past president of our local Kiwanis club, Motto: "Serving the Children of the World" and just awarded a 50 year plaque and pin, and a member of many antique car clubs and a member of a Methodist church next door to my house, and  I love sports, and wear hearing aids so I never have the sound on any of my TV sets. So it is stone quiet in my house and you can play your music and TV sound all you want because I can't hear it. I have 5 book cases of books about everything, so you can maybe enjoy some reading while visiting. And course every guest gets a free ride in one of my antique cars I have here. Plus I have free W-Fi for you and cable TV etc etc .Bottled water and instant coffee and treats and juices in the kit for u of course. Looking forward. Faithfully Lance Haynes

name: California Dreaming (501)
summary: Cue the music "California Dreaming". Turn it up a bit so that you can hear it over the roar of the waves just past the tidepools directly in front of you.
space: Stretch back in a comfy lounge chair from the vantage point of your balcony perched fifty feet above the Pacific Ocean, with the beverage of your choice, watching the pelicans sailing by, the surfers,swimmers, and beachcombers at play. Welcome to the penthouse suite of 457 Coast Blvd. The trifold doors are pushed back and the panorama of the La Jolla coastline flows in, transforming as it goes. The silvery oak floors morph into driftwood, the sea-blue granite countertops become the waves rolling in. Over the bar floats a school of jelly fish, unaware of their function as a source of light. Walls are covered in sea grass or mirror to reflect more ocean views. Should you fall asleep in the living room, in front of the warm glow of the faux fireplace, be assured the sofa bed is extremely comfortable. In the master bedroom a king bed awaits with adjoining spa inspired bathroom with aqua glass walls and a shower of green Esmeralda granite. The guest room sleeps two, in the twin bed / chair

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

interaction: We respect our guest's privacy, but we do offer 24 hour concierge services.
house_rules: While our #1 priority is insuring that our valued guests enjoy their stay with us, we also have an equally as important commitment to our neighbors and our community.  Below are the house rules that we must enforce.  Please read them prior to confirming your reservation.  If you are not comfortable with these rules, we encourage you to please make alternate accommodations: Overnight occupancy (including children and infants) is not to exceed 4 people. 2 daytime visitors are permitted.  Day time hours are 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Any additional daytime visitors or overnight guests must be approved in writing by SeaBreeze Vacation Rentals.  You will be asked to vacate the property immediately (without refund) at the discretion of SeaBreeze Vacation Rentals if the maximum occupancy is exceeded. host_about: Whether it is luxury homes on the La Jolla cliffs, or quaint beach cottages on the Mission Beach boardwalk, SeaBreeze brings top quality service, management, passion, and dedication to the San Diego vacation rental market. Established in 2002, SeaBreeze truly epitomizes what it means to cater to not only vacationers, but to the property owners. A commitment to providing a once in a lifetime experience for guests, and a trusting and professional relationship with property owners is our top priority.
